00074 /*
00075  * early reply have fixed size, respectively in privacy and integrity mode.
00076  * so we calculate them only once.
00077  */
00078 static int gss_at_reply_off_integ;
00079 static int gss_at_reply_off_priv;
00080 
00081 
00082 static inline int msg_last_segidx(struct lustre_msg *msg)
00083 {
00084         LASSERT(msg->lm_bufcount > 0);
00085         return msg->lm_bufcount - 1;
00086 }
00087 static inline int msg_last_seglen(struct lustre_msg *msg)
00088 {
00089         return msg->lm_buflens[msg_last_segidx(msg)];
00090 }
00091 
00092 /********************************************
00093  * wire data swabber                        *
00094  ********************************************/
00095 
00096 static
00097 void gss_header_swabber(struct gss_header *ghdr)
00098 {
00099         __swab32s(&ghdr->gh_flags);
00100         __swab32s(&ghdr->gh_proc);
00101         __swab32s(&ghdr->gh_seq);
00102         __swab32s(&ghdr->gh_svc);
00103         __swab32s(&ghdr->gh_pad1);
00104         __swab32s(&ghdr->gh_handle.len);
00105 }
00106 
00107 struct gss_header *gss_swab_header(struct lustre_msg *msg, int segment,
00108                                    int swabbed)
00109 {
00110         struct gss_header *ghdr;
00111 
00112         ghdr = lustre_msg_buf(msg, segment, sizeof(*ghdr));
00113         if (ghdr == NULL)
00114                 return NULL;
00115 
00116         if (swabbed)
00117                 gss_header_swabber(ghdr);
00118 
00119         if (sizeof(*ghdr) + ghdr->gh_handle.len > msg->lm_buflens[segment]) {
00120                 CERROR("gss header has length %d, now %u received\n",
00121                        (int) sizeof(*ghdr) + ghdr->gh_handle.len,
00122                        msg->lm_buflens[segment]);
00123                 return NULL;
00124         }
00125 
00126         return ghdr;
00127 }
00128 
00129 #if 0
00130 static
00131 void gss_netobj_swabber(netobj_t *obj)
00132 {
00133         __swab32s(&obj->len);
00134 }
00135 
00136 netobj_t *gss_swab_netobj(struct lustre_msg *msg, int segment)
00137 {
00138         netobj_t  *obj;
00139 
00140         obj = lustre_swab_buf(msg, segment, sizeof(*obj), gss_netobj_swabber);
00141         if (obj && sizeof(*obj) + obj->len > msg->lm_buflens[segment]) {
00142                 CERROR("netobj require length %u but only %u received\n",
00143                        (unsigned int) sizeof(*obj) + obj->len,
00144                        msg->lm_buflens[segment]);
00145                 return NULL;
00146         }
00147 
00148         return obj;
00149 }
00150 #endif

00152 /*
00153  * payload should be obtained from mechanism. but currently since we
00154  * only support kerberos, we could simply use fixed value.
00155  * krb5 "meta" data:
00156  *  - krb5 header:      16
00157  *  - krb5 checksum:    20
00158  *
00159  * for privacy mode, payload also include the cipher text which has the same
00160  * size as plain text, plus possible confounder, padding both at maximum cipher
00161  * block size.
00162  */
00163 #define GSS_KRB5_INTEG_MAX_PAYLOAD      (40)
00164 
00165 static inline
00166 int gss_mech_payload(struct gss_ctx *mechctx, int msgsize, int privacy)
00167 {
00168         if (privacy)
00169                 return GSS_KRB5_INTEG_MAX_PAYLOAD + 16 + 16 + 16 + msgsize;
00170         else
00171                 return GSS_KRB5_INTEG_MAX_PAYLOAD;
00172 }
00173 
00174 /*
00175  * return signature size, otherwise < 0 to indicate error
00176  */
00177 static int gss_sign_msg(struct lustre_msg *msg,
00178                         struct gss_ctx *mechctx,
00179                         enum lustre_sec_part sp,
00180                         __u32 flags, __u32 proc, __u32 seq, __u32 svc,
00181                         rawobj_t *handle)
00182 {
00183         struct gss_header      *ghdr;
00184         rawobj_t                text[4], mic;
00185         int                     textcnt, max_textcnt, mic_idx;
00186         __u32                   major;
00187 
00188         LASSERT(msg->lm_bufcount >= 2);
00189 
00190         /* gss hdr */
00191         LASSERT(msg->lm_buflens[0] >=
00192                 sizeof(*ghdr) + (handle ? handle->len : 0));
00193         ghdr = lustre_msg_buf(msg, 0, 0);
00194 
00195         ghdr->gh_version = PTLRPC_GSS_VERSION;
00196         ghdr->gh_sp = (__u8) sp;
00197         ghdr->gh_flags = flags;
00198         ghdr->gh_proc = proc;
00199         ghdr->gh_seq = seq;
00200         ghdr->gh_svc = svc;
00201         if (!handle) {
00202                 /* fill in a fake one */
00203                 ghdr->gh_handle.len = 0;
00204         } else {
00205                 ghdr->gh_handle.len = handle->len;
00206                 memcpy(ghdr->gh_handle.data, handle->data, handle->len);
00207         }
00208 
00209         /* no actual signature for null mode */
00210         if (svc == SPTLRPC_SVC_NULL)
00211                 return lustre_msg_size_v2(msg->lm_bufcount, msg->lm_buflens);
00212 
00213         /* MIC */
00214         mic_idx = msg_last_segidx(msg);
00215         max_textcnt = (svc == SPTLRPC_SVC_AUTH) ? 1 : mic_idx;
00216 
00217         for (textcnt = 0; textcnt < max_textcnt; textcnt++) {
00218                 text[textcnt].len = msg->lm_buflens[textcnt];
00219                 text[textcnt].data = lustre_msg_buf(msg, textcnt, 0);
00220         }
00221 
00222         mic.len = msg->lm_buflens[mic_idx];
00223         mic.data = lustre_msg_buf(msg, mic_idx, 0);
00224 
00225         major = lgss_get_mic(mechctx, textcnt, text, 0, NULL, &mic);
00226         if (major != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
00227                 CERROR("fail to generate MIC: %08x\n", major);
00228                 return -EPERM;
00229         }
00230         LASSERT(mic.len <= msg->lm_buflens[mic_idx]);
00231 
00232         return lustre_shrink_msg(msg, mic_idx, mic.len, 0);
00233 }
00234 
00235 /*
00236  * return gss error
00237  */
00238 static
00239 __u32 gss_verify_msg(struct lustre_msg *msg,
00240                      struct gss_ctx *mechctx,
00241                      __u32 svc)
00242 {
00243         rawobj_t        text[4], mic;
00244         int             textcnt, max_textcnt;
00245         int             mic_idx;
00246         __u32           major;
00247 
00248         LASSERT(msg->lm_bufcount >= 2);
00249 
00250         if (svc == SPTLRPC_SVC_NULL)
00251                 return GSS_S_COMPLETE;
00252 
00253         mic_idx = msg_last_segidx(msg);
00254         max_textcnt = (svc == SPTLRPC_SVC_AUTH) ? 1 : mic_idx;
00255 
00256         for (textcnt = 0; textcnt < max_textcnt; textcnt++) {
00257                 text[textcnt].len = msg->lm_buflens[textcnt];
00258                 text[textcnt].data = lustre_msg_buf(msg, textcnt, 0);
00259         }
00260 
00261         mic.len = msg->lm_buflens[mic_idx];
00262         mic.data = lustre_msg_buf(msg, mic_idx, 0);
00263 
00264         major = lgss_verify_mic(mechctx, textcnt, text, 0, NULL, &mic);
00265         if (major != GSS_S_COMPLETE)
00266                 CERROR("mic verify error: %08x\n", major);
00267 
00268         return major;
00269 }
00270 
00271 /*
00272  * return gss error code
00273  */
00274 static
00275 __u32 gss_unseal_msg(struct gss_ctx *mechctx,
00276                    struct lustre_msg *msgbuf,
00277                    int *msg_len, int msgbuf_len)
00278 {
00279         rawobj_t                 clear_obj, hdrobj, token;
00280         __u8                    *clear_buf;
00281         int                      clear_buflen;
00282         __u32                    major;
00283         ENTRY;
00284 
00285         if (msgbuf->lm_bufcount != 2) {
00286                 CERROR("invalid bufcount %d\n", msgbuf->lm_bufcount);
00287                 RETURN(GSS_S_FAILURE);
00288         }
00289 
00290         /* allocate a temporary clear text buffer, same sized as token,
00291          * we assume the final clear text size <= token size */
00292         clear_buflen = lustre_msg_buflen(msgbuf, 1);
00293         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(clear_buf, clear_buflen);
00294         if (!clear_buf)
00295                 RETURN(GSS_S_FAILURE);
00296 
00297         /* buffer objects */
00298         hdrobj.len = lustre_msg_buflen(msgbuf, 0);
00299         hdrobj.data = lustre_msg_buf(msgbuf, 0, 0);
00300         token.len = lustre_msg_buflen(msgbuf, 1);
00301         token.data = lustre_msg_buf(msgbuf, 1, 0);
00302         clear_obj.len = clear_buflen;
00303         clear_obj.data = clear_buf;
00304 
00305         major = lgss_unwrap(mechctx, &hdrobj, &token, &clear_obj);
00306         if (major != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
00307                 CERROR("unwrap message error: %08x\n", major);
00308                 GOTO(out_free, major = GSS_S_FAILURE);
00309         }
00310         LASSERT(clear_obj.len <= clear_buflen);
00311         LASSERT(clear_obj.len <= msgbuf_len);
00312 
00313         /* now the decrypted message */
00314         memcpy(msgbuf, clear_obj.data, clear_obj.len);
00315         *msg_len = clear_obj.len;
00316 
00317         major = GSS_S_COMPLETE;
00318 out_free:
00319         OBD_FREE_LARGE(clear_buf, clear_buflen);
00320         RETURN(major);
00321 }
00322 
00323 /********************************************
00324  * gss client context manipulation helpers  *
00325  ********************************************/
00326 
00327 int cli_ctx_expire(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx)
00328 {
00329         LASSERT(atomic_read(&ctx->cc_refcount));
00330 
00331         if (!test_and_set_bit(PTLRPC_CTX_DEAD_BIT, &ctx->cc_flags)) {
00332                 if (!ctx->cc_early_expire)
00333                         clear_bit(PTLRPC_CTX_UPTODATE_BIT, &ctx->cc_flags);
00334 
00335                 CWARN("ctx %p(%u->%s) get expired: %lu(%+lds)\n",
00336                       ctx, ctx->cc_vcred.vc_uid, sec2target_str(ctx->cc_sec),
00337                       ctx->cc_expire,
00338                       ctx->cc_expire == 0 ? 0 :
00339                       cfs_time_sub(ctx->cc_expire, cfs_time_current_sec()));
00340 
00341                 sptlrpc_cli_ctx_wakeup(ctx);
00342                 return 1;
00343         }
00344 
00345         return 0;
00346 }
00347 
00348 /*
00349  * return 1 if the context is dead.
00350  */
00351 int cli_ctx_check_death(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx)
00352 {
00353         if (unlikely(cli_ctx_is_dead(ctx)))
00354                 return 1;
00355 
00356         /* expire is 0 means never expire. a newly created gss context
00357          * which during upcall may has 0 expiration */
00358         if (ctx->cc_expire == 0)
00359                 return 0;
00360 
00361         /* check real expiration */
00362         if (cfs_time_after(ctx->cc_expire, cfs_time_current_sec()))
00363                 return 0;
00364 
00365         cli_ctx_expire(ctx);
00366         return 1;
00367 }
00368 
00369 void gss_cli_ctx_uptodate(struct gss_cli_ctx *gctx)
00370 {
00371         struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx  *ctx = &gctx->gc_base;
00372         unsigned long           ctx_expiry;
00373 
00374         if (lgss_inquire_context(gctx->gc_mechctx, &ctx_expiry)) {
00375                 CERROR("ctx %p(%u): unable to inquire, expire it now\n",
00376                        gctx, ctx->cc_vcred.vc_uid);
00377                 ctx_expiry = 1; /* make it expired now */
00378         }
00379 
00380         ctx->cc_expire = gss_round_ctx_expiry(ctx_expiry,
00381                                               ctx->cc_sec->ps_flvr.sf_flags);
00382 
00383         /* At this point this ctx might have been marked as dead by
00384          * someone else, in which case nobody will make further use
00385          * of it. we don't care, and mark it UPTODATE will help
00386          * destroying server side context when it be destroyed. */
00387         set_bit(PTLRPC_CTX_UPTODATE_BIT, &ctx->cc_flags);
00388 
00389         if (sec_is_reverse(ctx->cc_sec)) {
00390                 CWARN("server installed reverse ctx %p idx "LPX64", "
00391                       "expiry %lu(%+lds)\n", ctx,
00392                       gss_handle_to_u64(&gctx->gc_handle),
00393                       ctx->cc_expire, ctx->cc_expire - cfs_time_current_sec());
00394         } else {
00395                 CWARN("client refreshed ctx %p idx "LPX64" (%u->%s), "
00396                       "expiry %lu(%+lds)\n", ctx,
00397                       gss_handle_to_u64(&gctx->gc_handle),
00398                       ctx->cc_vcred.vc_uid, sec2target_str(ctx->cc_sec),
00399                       ctx->cc_expire, ctx->cc_expire - cfs_time_current_sec());
00400 
00401                 /* install reverse svc ctx for root context */
00402                 if (ctx->cc_vcred.vc_uid == 0)
00403                         gss_sec_install_rctx(ctx->cc_sec->ps_import,
00404                                              ctx->cc_sec, ctx);
00405         }
00406 
00407         sptlrpc_cli_ctx_wakeup(ctx);
00408 }
00409 
00410 static void gss_cli_ctx_finalize(struct gss_cli_ctx *gctx)
00411 {
00412         LASSERT(gctx->gc_base.cc_sec);
00413 
00414         if (gctx->gc_mechctx) {
00415                 lgss_delete_sec_context(&gctx->gc_mechctx);
00416                 gctx->gc_mechctx = NULL;
00417         }
00418 
00419         if (!rawobj_empty(&gctx->gc_svc_handle)) {
00420                 /* forward ctx: mark buddy reverse svcctx soon-expire. */
00421                 if (!sec_is_reverse(gctx->gc_base.cc_sec) &&
00422                     !rawobj_empty(&gctx->gc_svc_handle))
00423                         gss_svc_upcall_expire_rvs_ctx(&gctx->gc_svc_handle);
00424 
00425                 rawobj_free(&gctx->gc_svc_handle);
00426         }
00427 
00428         rawobj_free(&gctx->gc_handle);
00429 }
00430 
00469 static
00470 int gss_do_check_seq(unsigned long *window, __u32 win_size, __u32 *max_seq,
00471                      __u32 seq_num, int phase)
00472 {
00473         LASSERT(phase >= 0 && phase <= 2);
00474 
00475         if (seq_num > *max_seq) {
00476                 /*
00477                  * 1. high above the window
00478                  */
00479                 if (phase == 0)
00480                         return 0;
00481 
00482                 if (seq_num >= *max_seq + win_size) {
00483                         memset(window, 0, win_size / 8);
00484                         *max_seq = seq_num;
00485                 } else {
00486                         while(*max_seq < seq_num) {
00487                                 (*max_seq)++;
00488                                 __clear_bit((*max_seq) % win_size, window);
00489                         }
00490                 }
00491                 __set_bit(seq_num % win_size, window);
00492         } else if (seq_num + win_size <= *max_seq) {
00493                 /*
00494                  * 2. low behind the window
00495                  */
00496                 if (phase == 0 || phase == 2)
00497                         goto replay;
00498 
00499                 CWARN("seq %u is %u behind (size %d), check backup window\n",
00500                       seq_num, *max_seq - win_size - seq_num, win_size);
00501                 return 1;
00502         } else {
00503                 /*
00504                  * 3. fit into the window
00505                  */
00506                 switch (phase) {
00507                 case 0:
00508                         if (test_bit(seq_num % win_size, window))
00509                                 goto replay;
00510                         break;
00511                 case 1:
00512                 case 2:
00513                      if (__test_and_set_bit(seq_num % win_size, window))
00514                                 goto replay;
00515                         break;
00516                 }
00517         }
00518 
00519         return 0;
00520 
00521 replay:
00522         CERROR("seq %u (%s %s window) is a replay: max %u, winsize %d\n",
00523                seq_num,
00524                seq_num + win_size > *max_seq ? "in" : "behind",
00525                phase == 2 ? "backup " : "main",
00526                *max_seq, win_size);
00527         return -1;
00528 }
00529 
00530 /*
00531  * Based on sequence number algorithm as specified in RFC 2203.
00532  *
00533  * if @set == 0: initial check, don't set any bit in window
00534  * if @sec == 1: final check, set bit in window
00535  */
00536 int gss_check_seq_num(struct gss_svc_seq_data *ssd, __u32 seq_num, int set)
00537 {
00538         int rc = 0;
00539 
00540         spin_lock(&ssd->ssd_lock);
00541 
00542         if (set == 0) {
00543                 /*
00544                  * phase 0 testing
00545                  */
00546                 rc = gss_do_check_seq(ssd->ssd_win_main, GSS_SEQ_WIN_MAIN,
00547                                       &ssd->ssd_max_main, seq_num, 0);
00548                 if (unlikely(rc))
00549                         gss_stat_oos_record_svc(0, 1);
00550         } else {
00551                 /*
00552                  * phase 1 checking main window
00553                  */
00554                 rc = gss_do_check_seq(ssd->ssd_win_main, GSS_SEQ_WIN_MAIN,
00555                                       &ssd->ssd_max_main, seq_num, 1);
00556                 switch (rc) {
00557                 case -1:
00558                         gss_stat_oos_record_svc(1, 1);
00559                         /* fall through */
00560                 case 0:
00561                         goto exit;
00562                 }
00563                 /*
00564                  * phase 2 checking back window
00565                  */
00566                 rc = gss_do_check_seq(ssd->ssd_win_back, GSS_SEQ_WIN_BACK,
00567                                       &ssd->ssd_max_back, seq_num, 2);
00568                 if (rc)
00569                         gss_stat_oos_record_svc(2, 1);
00570                 else
00571                         gss_stat_oos_record_svc(2, 0);
00572         }
00573 exit:
00574         spin_unlock(&ssd->ssd_lock);
00575         return rc;
00576 }
00577 
00578 /***************************************
00579  * cred APIs                           *
00580  ***************************************/
00581 
00582 static inline int gss_cli_payload(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx,
00583                                   int msgsize, int privacy)
00584 {
00585         return gss_mech_payload(NULL, msgsize, privacy);
00586 }
00587 
00588 static int gss_cli_bulk_payload(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx,
00589                                 struct sptlrpc_flavor *flvr,
00590                                 int reply, int read)
00591 {
00592         int     payload = sizeof(struct ptlrpc_bulk_sec_desc);
00593 
00594         LASSERT(SPTLRPC_FLVR_BULK_TYPE(flvr->sf_rpc) == SPTLRPC_BULK_DEFAULT);
00595 
00596         if ((!reply && !read) || (reply && read)) {
00597                 switch (SPTLRPC_FLVR_BULK_SVC(flvr->sf_rpc)) {
00598                 case SPTLRPC_BULK_SVC_NULL:
00599                         break;
00600                 case SPTLRPC_BULK_SVC_INTG:
00601                         payload += gss_cli_payload(ctx, 0, 0);
00602                         break;
00603                 case SPTLRPC_BULK_SVC_PRIV:
00604                         payload += gss_cli_payload(ctx, 0, 1);
00605                         break;
00606                 case SPTLRPC_BULK_SVC_AUTH:
00607                 default:
00608                         LBUG();
00609                 }
00610         }
00611 
00612         return payload;
00613 }
00614 
00615 int gss_cli_ctx_match(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx, struct vfs_cred *vcred)
00616 {
00617         return (ctx->cc_vcred.vc_uid == vcred->vc_uid);
00618 }
00619 
00620 void gss_cli_ctx_flags2str(unsigned long flags, char *buf, int bufsize)
00621 {
00622         buf[0] = '\0';
00623 
00624         if (flags & PTLRPC_CTX_NEW)
00625                 strlcat(buf, "new,", bufsize);
00626         if (flags & PTLRPC_CTX_UPTODATE)
00627                 strlcat(buf, "uptodate,", bufsize);
00628         if (flags & PTLRPC_CTX_DEAD)
00629                 strlcat(buf, "dead,", bufsize);
00630         if (flags & PTLRPC_CTX_ERROR)
00631                 strlcat(buf, "error,", bufsize);
00632         if (flags & PTLRPC_CTX_CACHED)
00633                 strlcat(buf, "cached,", bufsize);
00634         if (flags & PTLRPC_CTX_ETERNAL)
00635                 strlcat(buf, "eternal,", bufsize);
00636         if (buf[0] == '\0')
00637                 strlcat(buf, "-,", bufsize);
00638 }
00639 
00640 int gss_cli_ctx_sign(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx,
00641                      struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00642 {
00643         struct gss_cli_ctx      *gctx = ctx2gctx(ctx);
00644         __u32                    flags = 0, seq, svc;
00645         int                      rc;
00646         ENTRY;
00647 
00648         LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf);
00649         LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf->lm_bufcount >= 2);
00650         LASSERT(req->rq_cli_ctx == ctx);
00651 
00652         /* nothing to do for context negotiation RPCs */
00653         if (req->rq_ctx_init)
00654                 RETURN(0);
00655 
00656         svc = SPTLRPC_FLVR_SVC(req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc);
00657         if (req->rq_pack_bulk)
00658                 flags |= LUSTRE_GSS_PACK_BULK;
00659         if (req->rq_pack_udesc)
00660                 flags |= LUSTRE_GSS_PACK_USER;
00661 
00662 redo:
00663         seq = atomic_inc_return(&gctx->gc_seq);
00664 
00665         rc = gss_sign_msg(req->rq_reqbuf, gctx->gc_mechctx,
00666                           ctx->cc_sec->ps_part,
00667                           flags, gctx->gc_proc, seq, svc,
00668                           &gctx->gc_handle);
00669         if (rc < 0)
00670                 RETURN(rc);
00671 
00672         /* gss_sign_msg() msg might take long time to finish, in which period
00673          * more rpcs could be wrapped up and sent out. if we found too many
00674          * of them we should repack this rpc, because sent it too late might
00675          * lead to the sequence number fall behind the window on server and
00676          * be dropped. also applies to gss_cli_ctx_seal().
00677          *
00678          * Note: null mode doesn't check sequence number. */
00679         if (svc != SPTLRPC_SVC_NULL &&
00680             atomic_read(&gctx->gc_seq) - seq > GSS_SEQ_REPACK_THRESHOLD) {
00681                 int behind = atomic_read(&gctx->gc_seq) - seq;
00682 
00683                 gss_stat_oos_record_cli(behind);
00684                 CWARN("req %p: %u behind, retry signing\n", req, behind);
00685                 goto redo;
00686         }
00687 
00688         req->rq_reqdata_len = rc;
00689         RETURN(0);
00690 }
00691 
00692 static
00693 int gss_cli_ctx_handle_err_notify(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx,
00694                                   struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00695                                   struct gss_header *ghdr)
00696 {
00697         struct gss_err_header *errhdr;
00698         int rc;
00699 
00700         LASSERT(ghdr->gh_proc == PTLRPC_GSS_PROC_ERR);
00701 
00702         errhdr = (struct gss_err_header *) ghdr;
00703 
00704         CWARN("req x"LPU64"/t"LPU64", ctx %p idx "LPX64"(%u->%s): "
00705               "%sserver respond (%08x/%08x)\n",
00706               req->rq_xid, req->rq_transno, ctx,
00707               gss_handle_to_u64(&ctx2gctx(ctx)->gc_handle),
00708               ctx->cc_vcred.vc_uid, sec2target_str(ctx->cc_sec),
00709               sec_is_reverse(ctx->cc_sec) ? "reverse" : "",
00710               errhdr->gh_major, errhdr->gh_minor);
00711 
00712         /* context fini rpc, let it failed */
00713         if (req->rq_ctx_fini) {
00714                 CWARN("context fini rpc failed\n");
00715                 return -EINVAL;
00716         }
00717 
00718         /* reverse sec, just return error, don't expire this ctx because it's
00719          * crucial to callback rpcs. note if the callback rpc failed because
00720          * of bit flip during network transfer, the client will be evicted
00721          * directly. so more gracefully we probably want let it retry for
00722          * number of times. */
00723         if (sec_is_reverse(ctx->cc_sec))
00724                 return -EINVAL;
00725 
00726         if (errhdr->gh_major != GSS_S_NO_CONTEXT &&
00727             errhdr->gh_major != GSS_S_BAD_SIG)
00728                 return -EACCES;
00729 
00730         /* server return NO_CONTEXT might be caused by context expire
00731          * or server reboot/failover. we try to refresh a new ctx which
00732          * be transparent to upper layer.
00733          *
00734          * In some cases, our gss handle is possible to be incidentally
00735          * identical to another handle since the handle itself is not
00736          * fully random. In krb5 case, the GSS_S_BAD_SIG will be
00737          * returned, maybe other gss error for other mechanism.
00738          *
00739          * if we add new mechanism, make sure the correct error are
00740          * returned in this case. */
00741         CWARN("%s: server might lost the context, retrying\n",
00742               errhdr->gh_major == GSS_S_NO_CONTEXT ?  "NO_CONTEXT" : "BAD_SIG");
00743 
00744         sptlrpc_cli_ctx_expire(ctx);
00745 
00746         /* we need replace the ctx right here, otherwise during
00747          * resent we'll hit the logic in sptlrpc_req_refresh_ctx()
00748          * which keep the ctx with RESEND flag, thus we'll never
00749          * get rid of this ctx. */
00750         rc = sptlrpc_req_replace_dead_ctx(req);
00751         if (rc == 0)
00752                 req->rq_resend = 1;
00753 
00754         return rc;
00755 }
00756 
00757 int gss_cli_ctx_verify(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx,
00758                        struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00759 {
00760         struct gss_cli_ctx     *gctx;
00761         struct gss_header      *ghdr, *reqhdr;
00762         struct lustre_msg      *msg = req->rq_repdata;
00763         __u32                   major;
00764         int                     pack_bulk, swabbed, rc = 0;
00765         ENTRY;
00766 
00767         LASSERT(req->rq_cli_ctx == ctx);
00768         LASSERT(msg);
00769 
00770         gctx = container_of(ctx, struct gss_cli_ctx, gc_base);
00771 
00772         /* special case for context negotiation, rq_repmsg/rq_replen actually
00773          * are not used currently. but early reply always be treated normally */
00774         if (req->rq_ctx_init && !req->rq_early) {
00775                 req->rq_repmsg = lustre_msg_buf(msg, 1, 0);
00776                 req->rq_replen = msg->lm_buflens[1];
00777                 RETURN(0);
00778         }
00779 
00780         if (msg->lm_bufcount < 2 || msg->lm_bufcount > 4) {
00781                 CERROR("unexpected bufcount %u\n", msg->lm_bufcount);
00782                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00783         }
00784 
00785         swabbed = ptlrpc_rep_need_swab(req);
00786 
00787         ghdr = gss_swab_header(msg, 0, swabbed);
00788         if (ghdr == NULL) {
00789                 CERROR("can't decode gss header\n");
00790                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00791         }
00792 
00793         /* sanity checks */
00794         reqhdr = lustre_msg_buf(msg, 0, sizeof(*reqhdr));
00795         LASSERT(reqhdr);
00796 
00797         if (ghdr->gh_version != reqhdr->gh_version) {
00798                 CERROR("gss version %u mismatch, expect %u\n",
00799                        ghdr->gh_version, reqhdr->gh_version);
00800                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00801         }
00802 
00803         switch (ghdr->gh_proc) {
00804         case PTLRPC_GSS_PROC_DATA:
00805                 pack_bulk = ghdr->gh_flags & LUSTRE_GSS_PACK_BULK;
00806 
00807                 if (!req->rq_early && !equi(req->rq_pack_bulk == 1, pack_bulk)){
00808                         CERROR("%s bulk flag in reply\n",
00809                                req->rq_pack_bulk ? "missing" : "unexpected");
00810                         RETURN(-EPROTO);
00811                 }
00812 
00813                 if (ghdr->gh_seq != reqhdr->gh_seq) {
00814                         CERROR("seqnum %u mismatch, expect %u\n",
00815                                ghdr->gh_seq, reqhdr->gh_seq);
00816                         RETURN(-EPROTO);
00817                 }
00818 
00819                 if (ghdr->gh_svc != reqhdr->gh_svc) {
00820                         CERROR("svc %u mismatch, expect %u\n",
00821                                ghdr->gh_svc, reqhdr->gh_svc);
00822                         RETURN(-EPROTO);
00823                 }
00824 
00825                 if (swabbed)
00826                         gss_header_swabber(ghdr);
00827 
00828                 major = gss_verify_msg(msg, gctx->gc_mechctx, reqhdr->gh_svc);
00829                 if (major != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
00830                         CERROR("failed to verify reply: %x\n", major);
00831                         RETURN(-EPERM);
00832                 }
00833 
00834                 if (req->rq_early && reqhdr->gh_svc == SPTLRPC_SVC_NULL) {
00835                         __u32 cksum;
00836 
00837                         cksum = crc32_le(!(__u32) 0,
00838                                          lustre_msg_buf(msg, 1, 0),
00839                                          lustre_msg_buflen(msg, 1));
00840                         if (cksum != msg->lm_cksum) {
00841                                 CWARN("early reply checksum mismatch: "
00842                                       "%08x != %08x\n", cksum, msg->lm_cksum);
00843                                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00844                         }
00845                 }
00846 
00847                 if (pack_bulk) {
00848                         /* bulk checksum is right after the lustre msg */
00849                         if (msg->lm_bufcount < 3) {
00850                                 CERROR("Invalid reply bufcount %u\n",
00851                                        msg->lm_bufcount);
00852                                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00853                         }
00854 
00855                         rc = bulk_sec_desc_unpack(msg, 2, swabbed);
00856                         if (rc) {
00857                                 CERROR("unpack bulk desc: %d\n", rc);
00858                                 RETURN(rc);
00859                         }
00860                 }
00861 
00862                 req->rq_repmsg = lustre_msg_buf(msg, 1, 0);
00863                 req->rq_replen = msg->lm_buflens[1];
00864                 break;
00865         case PTLRPC_GSS_PROC_ERR:
00866                 if (req->rq_early) {
00867                         CERROR("server return error with early reply\n");
00868                         rc = -EPROTO;
00869                 } else {
00870                         rc = gss_cli_ctx_handle_err_notify(ctx, req, ghdr);
00871                 }
00872                 break;
00873         default:
00874                 CERROR("unknown gss proc %d\n", ghdr->gh_proc);
00875                 rc = -EPROTO;
00876         }
00877 
00878         RETURN(rc);
00879 }
00880 
00881 int gss_cli_ctx_seal(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx,
00882                      struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00883 {
00884         struct gss_cli_ctx      *gctx;
00885         rawobj_t                 hdrobj, msgobj, token;
00886         struct gss_header       *ghdr;
00887         __u32                    buflens[2], major;
00888         int                      wiresize, rc;
00889         ENTRY;
00890 
00891         LASSERT(req->rq_clrbuf);
00892         LASSERT(req->rq_cli_ctx == ctx);
00893         LASSERT(req->rq_reqlen);
00894 
00895         gctx = container_of(ctx, struct gss_cli_ctx, gc_base);
00896 
00897         /* final clear data length */
00898         req->rq_clrdata_len = lustre_msg_size_v2(req->rq_clrbuf->lm_bufcount,
00899                                                  req->rq_clrbuf->lm_buflens);
00900 
00901         /* calculate wire data length */
00902         buflens[0] = PTLRPC_GSS_HEADER_SIZE;
00903         buflens[1] = gss_cli_payload(&gctx->gc_base, req->rq_clrdata_len, 1);
00904         wiresize = lustre_msg_size_v2(2, buflens);
00905 
00906         /* allocate wire buffer */
00907         if (req->rq_pool) {
00908                 /* pre-allocated */
00909                 LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf);
00910                 LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf != req->rq_clrbuf);
00911                 LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf_len >= wiresize);
00912         } else {
00913                 OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(req->rq_reqbuf, wiresize);
00914                 if (!req->rq_reqbuf)
00915                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00916                 req->rq_reqbuf_len = wiresize;
00917         }
00918 
00919         lustre_init_msg_v2(req->rq_reqbuf, 2, buflens, NULL);
00920         req->rq_reqbuf->lm_secflvr = req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc;
00921 
00922         /* gss header */
00923         ghdr = lustre_msg_buf(req->rq_reqbuf, 0, 0);
00924         ghdr->gh_version = PTLRPC_GSS_VERSION;
00925         ghdr->gh_sp = (__u8) ctx->cc_sec->ps_part;
00926         ghdr->gh_flags = 0;
00927         ghdr->gh_proc = gctx->gc_proc;
00928         ghdr->gh_svc = SPTLRPC_SVC_PRIV;
00929         ghdr->gh_handle.len = gctx->gc_handle.len;
00930         memcpy(ghdr->gh_handle.data, gctx->gc_handle.data, gctx->gc_handle.len);
00931         if (req->rq_pack_bulk)
00932                 ghdr->gh_flags |= LUSTRE_GSS_PACK_BULK;
00933         if (req->rq_pack_udesc)
00934                 ghdr->gh_flags |= LUSTRE_GSS_PACK_USER;
00935 
00936 redo:
00937         ghdr->gh_seq = atomic_inc_return(&gctx->gc_seq);
00938 
00939         /* buffer objects */
00940         hdrobj.len = PTLRPC_GSS_HEADER_SIZE;
00941         hdrobj.data = (__u8 *) ghdr;
00942         msgobj.len = req->rq_clrdata_len;
00943         msgobj.data = (__u8 *) req->rq_clrbuf;
00944         token.len = lustre_msg_buflen(req->rq_reqbuf, 1);
00945         token.data = lustre_msg_buf(req->rq_reqbuf, 1, 0);
00946 
00947         major = lgss_wrap(gctx->gc_mechctx, &hdrobj, &msgobj,
00948                           req->rq_clrbuf_len, &token);
00949         if (major != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
00950                 CERROR("priv: wrap message error: %08x\n", major);
00951                 GOTO(err_free, rc = -EPERM);
00952         }
00953         LASSERT(token.len <= buflens[1]);
00954 
00955         /* see explain in gss_cli_ctx_sign() */
00956         if (unlikely(atomic_read(&gctx->gc_seq) - ghdr->gh_seq >
00957                      GSS_SEQ_REPACK_THRESHOLD)) {
00958                 int behind = atomic_read(&gctx->gc_seq) - ghdr->gh_seq;
00959 
00960                 gss_stat_oos_record_cli(behind);
00961                 CWARN("req %p: %u behind, retry sealing\n", req, behind);
00962 
00963                 ghdr->gh_seq = atomic_inc_return(&gctx->gc_seq);
00964                 goto redo;
00965         }
00966 
00967         /* now set the final wire data length */
00968         req->rq_reqdata_len = lustre_shrink_msg(req->rq_reqbuf, 1, token.len,0);
00969         RETURN(0);
00970 
00971 err_free:
00972         if (!req->rq_pool) {
00973                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(req->rq_reqbuf, req->rq_reqbuf_len);
00974                 req->rq_reqbuf = NULL;
00975                 req->rq_reqbuf_len = 0;
00976         }
00977         RETURN(rc);
00978 }
00979 
00980 int gss_cli_ctx_unseal(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx,
00981                        struct ptlrpc_request *req)
00982 {
00983         struct gss_cli_ctx      *gctx;
00984         struct gss_header       *ghdr;
00985         struct lustre_msg       *msg = req->rq_repdata;
00986         int                      msglen, pack_bulk, swabbed, rc;
00987         __u32                    major;
00988         ENTRY;
00989 
00990         LASSERT(req->rq_cli_ctx == ctx);
00991         LASSERT(req->rq_ctx_init == 0);
00992         LASSERT(msg);
00993 
00994         gctx = container_of(ctx, struct gss_cli_ctx, gc_base);
00995         swabbed = ptlrpc_rep_need_swab(req);
00996 
00997         ghdr = gss_swab_header(msg, 0, swabbed);
00998         if (ghdr == NULL) {
00999                 CERROR("can't decode gss header\n");
01000                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
01001         }
01002 
01003         /* sanity checks */
01004         if (ghdr->gh_version != PTLRPC_GSS_VERSION) {
01005                 CERROR("gss version %u mismatch, expect %u\n",
01006                        ghdr->gh_version, PTLRPC_GSS_VERSION);
01007                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
01008         }
01009 
01010         switch (ghdr->gh_proc) {
01011         case PTLRPC_GSS_PROC_DATA:
01012                 pack_bulk = ghdr->gh_flags & LUSTRE_GSS_PACK_BULK;
01013 
01014                 if (!req->rq_early && !equi(req->rq_pack_bulk == 1, pack_bulk)){
01015                         CERROR("%s bulk flag in reply\n",
01016                                req->rq_pack_bulk ? "missing" : "unexpected");
01017                         RETURN(-EPROTO);
01018                 }
01019 
01020                 if (swabbed)
01021                         gss_header_swabber(ghdr);
01022 
01023                 /* use rq_repdata_len as buffer size, which assume unseal
01024                  * doesn't need extra memory space. for precise control, we'd
01025                  * better calculate out actual buffer size as
01026                  * (repbuf_len - offset - repdata_len) */
01027                 major = gss_unseal_msg(gctx->gc_mechctx, msg,
01028                                        &msglen, req->rq_repdata_len);
01029                 if (major != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
01030                         CERROR("failed to unwrap reply: %x\n", major);
01031                         rc = -EPERM;
01032                         break;
01033                 }
01034 
01035                 swabbed = __lustre_unpack_msg(msg, msglen);
01036                 if (swabbed < 0) {
01037                         CERROR("Failed to unpack after decryption\n");
01038                         RETURN(-EPROTO);
01039                 }
01040 
01041                 if (msg->lm_bufcount < 1) {
01042                         CERROR("Invalid reply buffer: empty\n");
01043                         RETURN(-EPROTO);
01044                 }
01045 
01046                 if (pack_bulk) {
01047                         if (msg->lm_bufcount < 2) {
01048                                 CERROR("bufcount %u: missing bulk sec desc\n",
01049                                        msg->lm_bufcount);
01050                                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
01051                         }
01052 
01053                         /* bulk checksum is the last segment */
01054                         if (bulk_sec_desc_unpack(msg, msg->lm_bufcount - 1,
01055                                                  swabbed))
01056                                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
01057                 }
01058 
01059                 req->rq_repmsg = lustre_msg_buf(msg, 0, 0);
01060                 req->rq_replen = msg->lm_buflens[0];
01061 
01062                 rc = 0;
01063                 break;
01064         case PTLRPC_GSS_PROC_ERR:
01065                 if (req->rq_early) {
01066                         CERROR("server return error with early reply\n");
01067                         rc = -EPROTO;
01068                 } else {
01069                         rc = gss_cli_ctx_handle_err_notify(ctx, req, ghdr);
01070                 }
01071                 break;
01072         default:
01073                 CERROR("unexpected proc %d\n", ghdr->gh_proc);
01074                 rc = -EPERM;
01075         }
01076 
01077         RETURN(rc);
01078 }
01079 
01080 /*********************************************
01081  * reverse context installation              *
01082  *********************************************/
01083 
01084 static inline
01085 int gss_install_rvs_svc_ctx(struct obd_import *imp,
01086                             struct gss_sec *gsec,
01087                             struct gss_cli_ctx *gctx)
01088 {
01089         return gss_svc_upcall_install_rvs_ctx(imp, gsec, gctx);
01090 }
01091 
01092 /*********************************************
01093  * GSS security APIs                         *
01094  *********************************************/
01095 int gss_sec_create_common(struct gss_sec *gsec,
01096                           struct ptlrpc_sec_policy *policy,
01097                           struct obd_import *imp,
01098                           struct ptlrpc_svc_ctx *svcctx,
01099                           struct sptlrpc_flavor *sf)
01100 {
01101         struct ptlrpc_sec   *sec;
01102 
01103         LASSERT(imp);
01104         LASSERT(SPTLRPC_FLVR_POLICY(sf->sf_rpc) == SPTLRPC_POLICY_GSS);
01105 
01106         gsec->gs_mech = lgss_subflavor_to_mech(
01107                                 SPTLRPC_FLVR_BASE_SUB(sf->sf_rpc));
01108         if (!gsec->gs_mech) {
01109                 CERROR("gss backend 0x%x not found\n",
01110                        SPTLRPC_FLVR_BASE_SUB(sf->sf_rpc));
01111                 return -EOPNOTSUPP;
01112         }
01113 
01114         spin_lock_init(&gsec->gs_lock);
01115         gsec->gs_rvs_hdl = 0ULL;
01116 
01117         /* initialize upper ptlrpc_sec */
01118         sec = &gsec->gs_base;
01119         sec->ps_policy = policy;
01120         atomic_set(&sec->ps_refcount, 0);
01121         atomic_set(&sec->ps_nctx, 0);
01122         sec->ps_id = sptlrpc_get_next_secid();
01123         sec->ps_flvr = *sf;
01124         sec->ps_import = class_import_get(imp);
01125         spin_lock_init(&sec->ps_lock);
01126         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&sec->ps_gc_list);
01127 
01128         if (!svcctx) {
01129                 sec->ps_gc_interval = GSS_GC_INTERVAL;
01130         } else {
01131                 LASSERT(sec_is_reverse(sec));
01132 
01133                 /* never do gc on reverse sec */
01134                 sec->ps_gc_interval = 0;
01135         }
01136 
01137         if (SPTLRPC_FLVR_BULK_SVC(sec->ps_flvr.sf_rpc) == SPTLRPC_BULK_SVC_PRIV)
01138                 sptlrpc_enc_pool_add_user();
01139 
01140         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "create %s%s@%p\n", (svcctx ? "reverse " : ""),
01141                policy->sp_name, gsec);
01142         return 0;
01143 }
01144 
01145 void gss_sec_destroy_common(struct gss_sec *gsec)
01146 {
01147         struct ptlrpc_sec       *sec = &gsec->gs_base;
01148         ENTRY;
01149 
01150         LASSERT(sec->ps_import);
01151         LASSERT(atomic_read(&sec->ps_refcount) == 0);
01152         LASSERT(atomic_read(&sec->ps_nctx) == 0);
01153 
01154         if (gsec->gs_mech) {
01155                 lgss_mech_put(gsec->gs_mech);
01156                 gsec->gs_mech = NULL;
01157         }
01158 
01159         class_import_put(sec->ps_import);
01160 
01161         if (SPTLRPC_FLVR_BULK_SVC(sec->ps_flvr.sf_rpc) == SPTLRPC_BULK_SVC_PRIV)
01162                 sptlrpc_enc_pool_del_user();
01163 
01164         EXIT;
01165 }
01166 
01167 void gss_sec_kill(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec)
01168 {
01169         sec->ps_dying = 1;
01170 }
01171 
01172 int gss_cli_ctx_init_common(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
01173                             struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx,
01174                             struct ptlrpc_ctx_ops *ctxops,
01175                             struct vfs_cred *vcred)
01176 {
01177         struct gss_cli_ctx      *gctx = ctx2gctx(ctx);
01178 
01179         gctx->gc_win = 0;
01180         atomic_set(&gctx->gc_seq, 0);
01181 
01182         INIT_HLIST_NODE(&ctx->cc_cache);
01183         atomic_set(&ctx->cc_refcount, 0);
01184         ctx->cc_sec = sec;
01185         ctx->cc_ops = ctxops;
01186         ctx->cc_expire = 0;
01187         ctx->cc_flags = PTLRPC_CTX_NEW;
01188         ctx->cc_vcred = *vcred;
01189         spin_lock_init(&ctx->cc_lock);
01190         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ctx->cc_req_list);
01191         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ctx->cc_gc_chain);
01192 
01193         /* take a ref on belonging sec, balanced in ctx destroying */
01194         atomic_inc(&sec->ps_refcount);
01195         /* statistic only */
01196         atomic_inc(&sec->ps_nctx);
01197 
01198         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "%s@%p: create ctx %p(%u->%s)\n",
01199                sec->ps_policy->sp_name, ctx->cc_sec,
01200                ctx, ctx->cc_vcred.vc_uid, sec2target_str(ctx->cc_sec));
01201         return 0;
01202 }
01203 
01204 /*
01205  * return value:
01206  *   1: the context has been taken care of by someone else
01207  *   0: proceed to really destroy the context locally
01208  */
01209 int gss_cli_ctx_fini_common(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
01210                             struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx)
01211 {
01212         struct gss_cli_ctx *gctx = ctx2gctx(ctx);
01213 
01214         LASSERT(atomic_read(&sec->ps_nctx) > 0);
01215         LASSERT(atomic_read(&ctx->cc_refcount) == 0);
01216         LASSERT(ctx->cc_sec == sec);
01217 
01218         /*
01219          * remove UPTODATE flag of reverse ctx thus we won't send fini rpc,
01220          * this is to avoid potential problems of client side reverse svc ctx
01221          * be mis-destroyed in various recovery senarios. anyway client can
01222          * manage its reverse ctx well by associating it with its buddy ctx.
01223          */
01224         if (sec_is_reverse(sec))
01225                 ctx->cc_flags &= ~PTLRPC_CTX_UPTODATE;
01226 
01227         if (gctx->gc_mechctx) {
01228                 /* the final context fini rpc will use this ctx too, and it's
01229                  * asynchronous which finished by request_out_callback(). so
01230                  * we add refcount, whoever drop finally drop the refcount to
01231                  * 0 should responsible for the rest of destroy. */
01232                 atomic_inc(&ctx->cc_refcount);
01233 
01234                 gss_do_ctx_fini_rpc(gctx);
01235                 gss_cli_ctx_finalize(gctx);
01236 
01237                 if (!atomic_dec_and_test(&ctx->cc_refcount))
01238                         return 1;
01239         }
01240 
01241         if (sec_is_reverse(sec))
01242                 CWARN("reverse sec %p: destroy ctx %p\n",
01243                       ctx->cc_sec, ctx);
01244         else
01245                 CWARN("%s@%p: destroy ctx %p(%u->%s)\n",
01246                       sec->ps_policy->sp_name, ctx->cc_sec,
01247                       ctx, ctx->cc_vcred.vc_uid, sec2target_str(ctx->cc_sec));
01248 
01249         return 0;
01250 }
01251 
01252 static
01253 int gss_alloc_reqbuf_intg(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
01254                           struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01255                           int svc, int msgsize)
01256 {
01257         int                       bufsize, txtsize;
01258         int                       bufcnt = 2;
01259         __u32                     buflens[5];
01260         ENTRY;
01261 
01262         /*
01263          * on-wire data layout:
01264          * - gss header
01265          * - lustre message
01266          * - user descriptor (optional)
01267          * - bulk sec descriptor (optional)
01268          * - signature (optional)
01269          *   - svc == NULL: NULL
01270          *   - svc == AUTH: signature of gss header
01271          *   - svc == INTG: signature of all above
01272          *
01273          * if this is context negotiation, reserver fixed space
01274          * at the last (signature) segment regardless of svc mode.
01275          */
01276 
01277         buflens[0] = PTLRPC_GSS_HEADER_SIZE;
01278         txtsize = buflens[0];
01279 
01280         buflens[1] = msgsize;
01281         if (svc == SPTLRPC_SVC_INTG)
01282                 txtsize += buflens[1];
01283 
01284         if (req->rq_pack_udesc) {
01285                 buflens[bufcnt] = sptlrpc_current_user_desc_size();
01286                 if (svc == SPTLRPC_SVC_INTG)
01287                         txtsize += buflens[bufcnt];
01288                 bufcnt++;
01289         }
01290 
01291         if (req->rq_pack_bulk) {
01292                 buflens[bufcnt] = gss_cli_bulk_payload(req->rq_cli_ctx,
01293                                                        &req->rq_flvr,
01294                                                        0, req->rq_bulk_read);
01295                 if (svc == SPTLRPC_SVC_INTG)
01296                         txtsize += buflens[bufcnt];
01297                 bufcnt++;
01298         }
01299 
01300         if (req->rq_ctx_init)
01301                 buflens[bufcnt++] = GSS_CTX_INIT_MAX_LEN;
01302         else if (svc != SPTLRPC_SVC_NULL)
01303                 buflens[bufcnt++] = gss_cli_payload(req->rq_cli_ctx, txtsize,0);
01304 
01305         bufsize = lustre_msg_size_v2(bufcnt, buflens);
01306 
01307         if (!req->rq_reqbuf) {
01308                 bufsize = size_roundup_power2(bufsize);
01309 
01310                 OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(req->rq_reqbuf, bufsize);
01311                 if (!req->rq_reqbuf)
01312                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01313 
01314                 req->rq_reqbuf_len = bufsize;
01315         } else {
01316                 LASSERT(req->rq_pool);
01317                 LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf_len >= bufsize);
01318                 memset(req->rq_reqbuf, 0, bufsize);
01319         }
01320 
01321         lustre_init_msg_v2(req->rq_reqbuf, bufcnt, buflens, NULL);
01322         req->rq_reqbuf->lm_secflvr = req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc;
01323 
01324         req->rq_reqmsg = lustre_msg_buf(req->rq_reqbuf, 1, msgsize);
01325         LASSERT(req->rq_reqmsg);
01326 
01327         /* pack user desc here, later we might leave current user's process */
01328         if (req->rq_pack_udesc)
01329                 sptlrpc_pack_user_desc(req->rq_reqbuf, 2);
01330 
01331         RETURN(0);
01332 }
01333 
01334 static
01335 int gss_alloc_reqbuf_priv(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
01336                           struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01337                           int msgsize)
01338 {
01339         __u32                     ibuflens[3], wbuflens[2];
01340         int                       ibufcnt;
01341         int                       clearsize, wiresize;
01342         ENTRY;
01343 
01344         LASSERT(req->rq_clrbuf == NULL);
01345         LASSERT(req->rq_clrbuf_len == 0);
01346 
01347         /* Inner (clear) buffers
01348          *  - lustre message
01349          *  - user descriptor (optional)
01350          *  - bulk checksum (optional)
01351          */
01352         ibufcnt = 1;
01353         ibuflens[0] = msgsize;
01354 
01355         if (req->rq_pack_udesc)
01356                 ibuflens[ibufcnt++] = sptlrpc_current_user_desc_size();
01357         if (req->rq_pack_bulk)
01358                 ibuflens[ibufcnt++] = gss_cli_bulk_payload(req->rq_cli_ctx,
01359                                                            &req->rq_flvr, 0,
01360                                                            req->rq_bulk_read);
01361 
01362         clearsize = lustre_msg_size_v2(ibufcnt, ibuflens);
01363         /* to allow append padding during encryption */
01364         clearsize += GSS_MAX_CIPHER_BLOCK;
01365 
01366         /* Wrapper (wire) buffers
01367          *  - gss header
01368          *  - cipher text
01369          */
01370         wbuflens[0] = PTLRPC_GSS_HEADER_SIZE;
01371         wbuflens[1] = gss_cli_payload(req->rq_cli_ctx, clearsize, 1);
01372         wiresize = lustre_msg_size_v2(2, wbuflens);
01373 
01374         if (req->rq_pool) {
01375                 /* rq_reqbuf is preallocated */
01376                 LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf);
01377                 LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf_len >= wiresize);
01378 
01379                 memset(req->rq_reqbuf, 0, req->rq_reqbuf_len);
01380 
01381                 /* if the pre-allocated buffer is big enough, we just pack
01382                  * both clear buf & request buf in it, to avoid more alloc. */
01383                 if (clearsize + wiresize <= req->rq_reqbuf_len) {
01384                         req->rq_clrbuf =
01385                                 (void *) (((char *) req->rq_reqbuf) + wiresize);
01386                 } else {
01387                         CWARN("pre-allocated buf size %d is not enough for "
01388                               "both clear (%d) and cipher (%d) text, proceed "
01389                               "with extra allocation\n", req->rq_reqbuf_len,
01390                               clearsize, wiresize);
01391                 }
01392         }
01393 
01394         if (!req->rq_clrbuf) {
01395                 clearsize = size_roundup_power2(clearsize);
01396 
01397                 OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(req->rq_clrbuf, clearsize);
01398                 if (!req->rq_clrbuf)
01399                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01400         }
01401         req->rq_clrbuf_len = clearsize;
01402 
01403         lustre_init_msg_v2(req->rq_clrbuf, ibufcnt, ibuflens, NULL);
01404         req->rq_reqmsg = lustre_msg_buf(req->rq_clrbuf, 0, msgsize);
01405 
01406         if (req->rq_pack_udesc)
01407                 sptlrpc_pack_user_desc(req->rq_clrbuf, 1);
01408 
01409         RETURN(0);
01410 }
01411 
01412 /*
01413  * NOTE: any change of request buffer allocation should also consider
01414  * changing enlarge_reqbuf() series functions.
01415  */
01416 int gss_alloc_reqbuf(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
01417                      struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01418                      int msgsize)
01419 {
01420         int     svc = SPTLRPC_FLVR_SVC(req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc);
01421 
01422         LASSERT(!req->rq_pack_bulk ||
01423                 (req->rq_bulk_read || req->rq_bulk_write));
01424 
01425         switch (svc) {
01426         case SPTLRPC_SVC_NULL:
01427         case SPTLRPC_SVC_AUTH:
01428         case SPTLRPC_SVC_INTG:
01429                 return gss_alloc_reqbuf_intg(sec, req, svc, msgsize);
01430         case SPTLRPC_SVC_PRIV:
01431                 return gss_alloc_reqbuf_priv(sec, req, msgsize);
01432         default:
01433                 LASSERTF(0, "bad rpc flavor %x\n", req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc);
01434                 return 0;
01435         }
01436 }
01437 
01438 void gss_free_reqbuf(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
01439                      struct ptlrpc_request *req)
01440 {
01441         int     privacy;
01442         ENTRY;
01443 
01444         LASSERT(!req->rq_pool || req->rq_reqbuf);
01445         privacy = SPTLRPC_FLVR_SVC(req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc) == SPTLRPC_SVC_PRIV;
01446 
01447         if (!req->rq_clrbuf)
01448                 goto release_reqbuf;
01449 
01450         /* release clear buffer */
01451         LASSERT(privacy);
01452         LASSERT(req->rq_clrbuf_len);
01453 
01454         if (req->rq_pool == NULL ||
01455             req->rq_clrbuf < req->rq_reqbuf ||
01456             (char *) req->rq_clrbuf >=
01457             (char *) req->rq_reqbuf + req->rq_reqbuf_len)
01458                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(req->rq_clrbuf, req->rq_clrbuf_len);
01459 
01460         req->rq_clrbuf = NULL;
01461         req->rq_clrbuf_len = 0;
01462 
01463 release_reqbuf:
01464         if (!req->rq_pool && req->rq_reqbuf) {
01465                 LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf_len);
01466 
01467                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(req->rq_reqbuf, req->rq_reqbuf_len);
01468                 req->rq_reqbuf = NULL;
01469                 req->rq_reqbuf_len = 0;
01470         }
01471 
01472         EXIT;
01473 }
01474 
01475 static int do_alloc_repbuf(struct ptlrpc_request *req, int bufsize)
01476 {
01477         bufsize = size_roundup_power2(bufsize);
01478 
01479         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(req->rq_repbuf, bufsize);
01480         if (!req->rq_repbuf)
01481                 return -ENOMEM;
01482 
01483         req->rq_repbuf_len = bufsize;
01484         return 0;
01485 }
01486 
01487 static
01488 int gss_alloc_repbuf_intg(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
01489                           struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01490                           int svc, int msgsize)
01491 {
01492         int             txtsize;
01493         __u32           buflens[4];
01494         int             bufcnt = 2;
01495         int             alloc_size;
01496 
01497         /*
01498          * on-wire data layout:
01499          * - gss header
01500          * - lustre message
01501          * - bulk sec descriptor (optional)
01502          * - signature (optional)
01503          *   - svc == NULL: NULL
01504          *   - svc == AUTH: signature of gss header
01505          *   - svc == INTG: signature of all above
01506          *
01507          * if this is context negotiation, reserver fixed space
01508          * at the last (signature) segment regardless of svc mode.
01509          */
01510 
01511         buflens[0] = PTLRPC_GSS_HEADER_SIZE;
01512         txtsize = buflens[0];
01513 
01514         buflens[1] = msgsize;
01515         if (svc == SPTLRPC_SVC_INTG)
01516                 txtsize += buflens[1];
01517 
01518         if (req->rq_pack_bulk) {
01519                 buflens[bufcnt] = gss_cli_bulk_payload(req->rq_cli_ctx,
01520                                                        &req->rq_flvr,
01521                                                        1, req->rq_bulk_read);
01522                 if (svc == SPTLRPC_SVC_INTG)
01523                         txtsize += buflens[bufcnt];
01524                 bufcnt++;
01525         }
01526 
01527         if (req->rq_ctx_init)
01528                 buflens[bufcnt++] = GSS_CTX_INIT_MAX_LEN;
01529         else if (svc != SPTLRPC_SVC_NULL)
01530                 buflens[bufcnt++] = gss_cli_payload(req->rq_cli_ctx, txtsize,0);
01531 
01532         alloc_size = lustre_msg_size_v2(bufcnt, buflens);
01533 
01534         /* add space for early reply */
01535         alloc_size += gss_at_reply_off_integ;
01536 
01537         return do_alloc_repbuf(req, alloc_size);
01538 }
01539 
01540 static
01541 int gss_alloc_repbuf_priv(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
01542                           struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01543                           int msgsize)
01544 {
01545         int             txtsize;
01546         __u32           buflens[2];
01547         int             bufcnt;
01548         int             alloc_size;
01549 
01550         /* inner buffers */
01551         bufcnt = 1;
01552         buflens[0] = msgsize;
01553 
01554         if (req->rq_pack_bulk)
01555                 buflens[bufcnt++] = gss_cli_bulk_payload(req->rq_cli_ctx,
01556                                                          &req->rq_flvr,
01557                                                          1, req->rq_bulk_read);
01558         txtsize = lustre_msg_size_v2(bufcnt, buflens);
01559         txtsize += GSS_MAX_CIPHER_BLOCK;
01560 
01561         /* wrapper buffers */
01562         bufcnt = 2;
01563         buflens[0] = PTLRPC_GSS_HEADER_SIZE;
01564         buflens[1] = gss_cli_payload(req->rq_cli_ctx, txtsize, 1);
01565 
01566         alloc_size = lustre_msg_size_v2(bufcnt, buflens);
01567         /* add space for early reply */
01568         alloc_size += gss_at_reply_off_priv;
01569 
01570         return do_alloc_repbuf(req, alloc_size);
01571 }
01572 
01573 int gss_alloc_repbuf(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
01574                      struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01575                      int msgsize)
01576 {
01577         int     svc = SPTLRPC_FLVR_SVC(req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc);
01578         ENTRY;
01579 
01580         LASSERT(!req->rq_pack_bulk ||
01581                 (req->rq_bulk_read || req->rq_bulk_write));
01582 
01583         switch (svc) {
01584         case SPTLRPC_SVC_NULL:
01585         case SPTLRPC_SVC_AUTH:
01586         case SPTLRPC_SVC_INTG:
01587                 return gss_alloc_repbuf_intg(sec, req, svc, msgsize);
01588         case SPTLRPC_SVC_PRIV:
01589                 return gss_alloc_repbuf_priv(sec, req, msgsize);
01590         default:
01591                 LASSERTF(0, "bad rpc flavor %x\n", req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc);
01592                 return 0;
01593         }
01594 }
01595 
01596 void gss_free_repbuf(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
01597                      struct ptlrpc_request *req)
01598 {
01599         OBD_FREE_LARGE(req->rq_repbuf, req->rq_repbuf_len);
01600         req->rq_repbuf = NULL;
01601         req->rq_repbuf_len = 0;
01602         req->rq_repdata = NULL;
01603         req->rq_repdata_len = 0;
01604 }
01605 
01606 static int get_enlarged_msgsize(struct lustre_msg *msg,
01607                                 int segment, int newsize)
01608 {
01609         int save, newmsg_size;
01610 
01611         LASSERT(newsize >= msg->lm_buflens[segment]);
01612 
01613         save = msg->lm_buflens[segment];
01614         msg->lm_buflens[segment] = newsize;
01615         newmsg_size = lustre_msg_size_v2(msg->lm_bufcount, msg->lm_buflens);
01616         msg->lm_buflens[segment] = save;
01617 
01618         return newmsg_size;
01619 }
01620 
01621 static int get_enlarged_msgsize2(struct lustre_msg *msg,
01622                                  int segment1, int newsize1,
01623                                  int segment2, int newsize2)
01624 {
01625         int save1, save2, newmsg_size;
01626 
01627         LASSERT(newsize1 >= msg->lm_buflens[segment1]);
01628         LASSERT(newsize2 >= msg->lm_buflens[segment2]);
01629 
01630         save1 = msg->lm_buflens[segment1];
01631         save2 = msg->lm_buflens[segment2];
01632         msg->lm_buflens[segment1] = newsize1;
01633         msg->lm_buflens[segment2] = newsize2;
01634         newmsg_size = lustre_msg_size_v2(msg->lm_bufcount, msg->lm_buflens);
01635         msg->lm_buflens[segment1] = save1;
01636         msg->lm_buflens[segment2] = save2;
01637 
01638         return newmsg_size;
01639 }
01640 
01641 static
01642 int gss_enlarge_reqbuf_intg(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
01643                             struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01644                             int svc,
01645                             int segment, int newsize)
01646 {
01647         struct lustre_msg      *newbuf;
01648         int                     txtsize, sigsize = 0, i;
01649         int                     newmsg_size, newbuf_size;
01650 
01651         /*
01652          * gss header is at seg 0;
01653          * embedded msg is at seg 1;
01654          * signature (if any) is at the last seg
01655          */
01656         LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf);
01657         LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf_len > req->rq_reqlen);
01658         LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf->lm_bufcount >= 2);
01659         LASSERT(lustre_msg_buf(req->rq_reqbuf, 1, 0) == req->rq_reqmsg);
01660 
01661         /* 1. compute new embedded msg size */
01662         newmsg_size = get_enlarged_msgsize(req->rq_reqmsg, segment, newsize);
01663         LASSERT(newmsg_size >= req->rq_reqbuf->lm_buflens[1]);
01664 
01665         /* 2. compute new wrapper msg size */
01666         if (svc == SPTLRPC_SVC_NULL) {
01667                 /* no signature, get size directly */
01668                 newbuf_size = get_enlarged_msgsize(req->rq_reqbuf,
01669                                                    1, newmsg_size);
01670         } else {
01671                 txtsize = req->rq_reqbuf->lm_buflens[0];
01672 
01673                 if (svc == SPTLRPC_SVC_INTG) {
01674                         for (i = 1; i < req->rq_reqbuf->lm_bufcount; i++)
01675                                 txtsize += req->rq_reqbuf->lm_buflens[i];
01676                         txtsize += newmsg_size - req->rq_reqbuf->lm_buflens[1];
01677                 }
01678 
01679                 sigsize = gss_cli_payload(req->rq_cli_ctx, txtsize, 0);
01680                 LASSERT(sigsize >= msg_last_seglen(req->rq_reqbuf));
01681 
01682                 newbuf_size = get_enlarged_msgsize2(
01683                                         req->rq_reqbuf,
01684                                         1, newmsg_size,
01685                                         msg_last_segidx(req->rq_reqbuf),
01686                                         sigsize);
01687         }
01688 
01689         /* request from pool should always have enough buffer */
01690         LASSERT(!req->rq_pool || req->rq_reqbuf_len >= newbuf_size);
01691 
01692         if (req->rq_reqbuf_len < newbuf_size) {
01693                 newbuf_size = size_roundup_power2(newbuf_size);
01694 
01695                 OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(newbuf, newbuf_size);
01696                 if (newbuf == NULL)
01697                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01698 
01699                 /* Must lock this, so that otherwise unprotected change of
01700                  * rq_reqmsg is not racing with parallel processing of
01701                  * imp_replay_list traversing threads. See LU-3333
01702                  * This is a bandaid at best, we really need to deal with this
01703                  * in request enlarging code before unpacking that's already
01704                  * there */
01705                 if (req->rq_import)
01706                         spin_lock(&req->rq_import->imp_lock);
01707 
01708                 memcpy(newbuf, req->rq_reqbuf, req->rq_reqbuf_len);
01709 
01710                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(req->rq_reqbuf, req->rq_reqbuf_len);
01711                 req->rq_reqbuf = newbuf;
01712                 req->rq_reqbuf_len = newbuf_size;
01713                 req->rq_reqmsg = lustre_msg_buf(req->rq_reqbuf, 1, 0);
01714 
01715                 if (req->rq_import)
01716                         spin_unlock(&req->rq_import->imp_lock);
01717         }
01718 
01719         /* do enlargement, from wrapper to embedded, from end to begin */
01720         if (svc != SPTLRPC_SVC_NULL)
01721                 _sptlrpc_enlarge_msg_inplace(req->rq_reqbuf,
01722                                              msg_last_segidx(req->rq_reqbuf),
01723                                              sigsize);
01724 
01725         _sptlrpc_enlarge_msg_inplace(req->rq_reqbuf, 1, newmsg_size);
01726         _sptlrpc_enlarge_msg_inplace(req->rq_reqmsg, segment, newsize);
01727 
01728         req->rq_reqlen = newmsg_size;
01729         RETURN(0);
01730 }
01731 
01732 static
01733 int gss_enlarge_reqbuf_priv(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
01734                             struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01735                             int segment, int newsize)
01736 {
01737         struct lustre_msg      *newclrbuf;
01738         int                     newmsg_size, newclrbuf_size, newcipbuf_size;
01739         __u32                   buflens[3];
01740 
01741         /*
01742          * embedded msg is at seg 0 of clear buffer;
01743          * cipher text is at seg 2 of cipher buffer;
01744          */
01745         LASSERT(req->rq_pool ||
01746                 (req->rq_reqbuf == NULL && req->rq_reqbuf_len == 0));
01747         LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf == NULL ||
01748                 (req->rq_pool && req->rq_reqbuf->lm_bufcount == 3));
01749         LASSERT(req->rq_clrbuf);
01750         LASSERT(req->rq_clrbuf_len > req->rq_reqlen);
01751         LASSERT(lustre_msg_buf(req->rq_clrbuf, 0, 0) == req->rq_reqmsg);
01752 
01753         /* compute new embedded msg size */
01754         newmsg_size = get_enlarged_msgsize(req->rq_reqmsg, segment, newsize);
01755 
01756         /* compute new clear buffer size */
01757         newclrbuf_size = get_enlarged_msgsize(req->rq_clrbuf, 0, newmsg_size);
01758         newclrbuf_size += GSS_MAX_CIPHER_BLOCK;
01759 
01760         /* compute new cipher buffer size */
01761         buflens[0] = PTLRPC_GSS_HEADER_SIZE;
01762         buflens[1] = gss_cli_payload(req->rq_cli_ctx, buflens[0], 0);
01763         buflens[2] = gss_cli_payload(req->rq_cli_ctx, newclrbuf_size, 1);
01764         newcipbuf_size = lustre_msg_size_v2(3, buflens);
01765 
01766         /* handle the case that we put both clear buf and cipher buf into
01767          * pre-allocated single buffer. */
01768         if (unlikely(req->rq_pool) &&
01769             req->rq_clrbuf >= req->rq_reqbuf &&
01770             (char *) req->rq_clrbuf <
01771             (char *) req->rq_reqbuf + req->rq_reqbuf_len) {
01772                 /* it couldn't be better we still fit into the
01773                  * pre-allocated buffer. */
01774                 if (newclrbuf_size + newcipbuf_size <= req->rq_reqbuf_len) {
01775                         void *src, *dst;
01776 
01777                         if (req->rq_import)
01778                                 spin_lock(&req->rq_import->imp_lock);
01779                         /* move clear text backward. */
01780                         src = req->rq_clrbuf;
01781                         dst = (char *) req->rq_reqbuf + newcipbuf_size;
01782 
01783                         memmove(dst, src, req->rq_clrbuf_len);
01784 
01785                         req->rq_clrbuf = (struct lustre_msg *) dst;
01786                         req->rq_clrbuf_len = newclrbuf_size;
01787                         req->rq_reqmsg = lustre_msg_buf(req->rq_clrbuf, 0, 0);
01788 
01789                         if (req->rq_import)
01790                                 spin_unlock(&req->rq_import->imp_lock);
01791                 } else {
01792                         /* sadly we have to split out the clear buffer */
01793                         LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf_len >= newcipbuf_size);
01794                         LASSERT(req->rq_clrbuf_len < newclrbuf_size);
01795                 }
01796         }
01797 
01798         if (req->rq_clrbuf_len < newclrbuf_size) {
01799                 newclrbuf_size = size_roundup_power2(newclrbuf_size);
01800 
01801                 OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(newclrbuf, newclrbuf_size);
01802                 if (newclrbuf == NULL)
01803                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01804 
01805                 /* Must lock this, so that otherwise unprotected change of
01806                  * rq_reqmsg is not racing with parallel processing of
01807                  * imp_replay_list traversing threads. See LU-3333
01808                  * This is a bandaid at best, we really need to deal with this
01809                  * in request enlarging code before unpacking that's already
01810                  * there */
01811                 if (req->rq_import)
01812                         spin_lock(&req->rq_import->imp_lock);
01813 
01814                 memcpy(newclrbuf, req->rq_clrbuf, req->rq_clrbuf_len);
01815 
01816                 if (req->rq_reqbuf == NULL ||
01817                     req->rq_clrbuf < req->rq_reqbuf ||
01818                     (char *) req->rq_clrbuf >=
01819                     (char *) req->rq_reqbuf + req->rq_reqbuf_len) {
01820                         OBD_FREE_LARGE(req->rq_clrbuf, req->rq_clrbuf_len);
01821                 }
01822 
01823                 req->rq_clrbuf = newclrbuf;
01824                 req->rq_clrbuf_len = newclrbuf_size;
01825                 req->rq_reqmsg = lustre_msg_buf(req->rq_clrbuf, 0, 0);
01826 
01827                 if (req->rq_import)
01828                         spin_unlock(&req->rq_import->imp_lock);
01829         }
01830 
01831         _sptlrpc_enlarge_msg_inplace(req->rq_clrbuf, 0, newmsg_size);
01832         _sptlrpc_enlarge_msg_inplace(req->rq_reqmsg, segment, newsize);
01833         req->rq_reqlen = newmsg_size;
01834 
01835         RETURN(0);
01836 }
01837 
01838 int gss_enlarge_reqbuf(struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
01839                        struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01840                        int segment, int newsize)
01841 {
01842         int     svc = SPTLRPC_FLVR_SVC(req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc);
01843 
01844         LASSERT(!req->rq_ctx_init && !req->rq_ctx_fini);
01845 
01846         switch (svc) {
01847         case SPTLRPC_SVC_NULL:
01848         case SPTLRPC_SVC_AUTH:
01849         case SPTLRPC_SVC_INTG:
01850                 return gss_enlarge_reqbuf_intg(sec, req, svc, segment, newsize);
01851         case SPTLRPC_SVC_PRIV:
01852                 return gss_enlarge_reqbuf_priv(sec, req, segment, newsize);
01853         default:
01854                 LASSERTF(0, "bad rpc flavor %x\n", req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc);
01855                 return 0;
01856         }
01857 }
01858 
01859 int gss_sec_install_rctx(struct obd_import *imp,
01860                          struct ptlrpc_sec *sec,
01861                          struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *ctx)
01862 {
01863         struct gss_sec     *gsec;
01864         struct gss_cli_ctx *gctx;
01865         int                 rc;
01866 
01867         gsec = container_of(sec, struct gss_sec, gs_base);
01868         gctx = container_of(ctx, struct gss_cli_ctx, gc_base);
01869 
01870         rc = gss_install_rvs_svc_ctx(imp, gsec, gctx);
01871         return rc;
01872 }
01873 
01874 /********************************************
01875  * server side API                          *
01876  ********************************************/
01877 
01878 static inline
01879 int gss_svc_reqctx_is_special(struct gss_svc_reqctx *grctx)
01880 {
01881         LASSERT(grctx);
01882         return (grctx->src_init || grctx->src_init_continue ||
01883                 grctx->src_err_notify);
01884 }
01885 
01886 static
01887 void gss_svc_reqctx_free(struct gss_svc_reqctx *grctx)
01888 {
01889         if (grctx->src_ctx)
01890                 gss_svc_upcall_put_ctx(grctx->src_ctx);
01891 
01892         sptlrpc_policy_put(grctx->src_base.sc_policy);
01893         OBD_FREE_PTR(grctx);
01894 }
01895 
01896 static inline
01897 void gss_svc_reqctx_addref(struct gss_svc_reqctx *grctx)
01898 {
01899         LASSERT(atomic_read(&grctx->src_base.sc_refcount) > 0);
01900         atomic_inc(&grctx->src_base.sc_refcount);
01901 }
01902 
01903 static inline
01904 void gss_svc_reqctx_decref(struct gss_svc_reqctx *grctx)
01905 {
01906         LASSERT(atomic_read(&grctx->src_base.sc_refcount) > 0);
01907 
01908         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&grctx->src_base.sc_refcount))
01909                 gss_svc_reqctx_free(grctx);
01910 }
01911 
01912 static
01913 int gss_svc_sign(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01914                  struct ptlrpc_reply_state *rs,
01915                  struct gss_svc_reqctx *grctx,
01916                  __u32 svc)
01917 {
01918         __u32   flags = 0;
01919         int     rc;
01920         ENTRY;
01921 
01922         LASSERT(rs->rs_msg == lustre_msg_buf(rs->rs_repbuf, 1, 0));
01923 
01924         /* embedded lustre_msg might have been shrunk */
01925         if (req->rq_replen != rs->rs_repbuf->lm_buflens[1])
01926                 lustre_shrink_msg(rs->rs_repbuf, 1, req->rq_replen, 1);
01927 
01928         if (req->rq_pack_bulk)
01929                 flags |= LUSTRE_GSS_PACK_BULK;
01930 
01931         rc = gss_sign_msg(rs->rs_repbuf, grctx->src_ctx->gsc_mechctx,
01932                           LUSTRE_SP_ANY, flags, PTLRPC_GSS_PROC_DATA,
01933                           grctx->src_wirectx.gw_seq, svc, NULL);
01934         if (rc < 0)
01935                 RETURN(rc);
01936 
01937         rs->rs_repdata_len = rc;
01938 
01939         if (likely(req->rq_packed_final)) {
01940                 if (lustre_msghdr_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) & MSGHDR_AT_SUPPORT)
01941                         req->rq_reply_off = gss_at_reply_off_integ;
01942                 else
01943                         req->rq_reply_off = 0;
01944         } else {
01945                 if (svc == SPTLRPC_SVC_NULL)
01946                         rs->rs_repbuf->lm_cksum = crc32_le(!(__u32) 0,
01947                                         lustre_msg_buf(rs->rs_repbuf, 1, 0),
01948                                         lustre_msg_buflen(rs->rs_repbuf, 1));
01949                 req->rq_reply_off = 0;
01950         }
01951 
01952         RETURN(0);
01953 }
01954 
01955 int gss_pack_err_notify(struct ptlrpc_request *req, __u32 major, __u32 minor)
01956 {
01957         struct gss_svc_reqctx     *grctx = gss_svc_ctx2reqctx(req->rq_svc_ctx);
01958         struct ptlrpc_reply_state *rs;
01959         struct gss_err_header     *ghdr;
01960         int                        replen = sizeof(struct ptlrpc_body);
01961         int                        rc;
01962         ENTRY;
01963 
01964         //if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK_ORSET(OBD_FAIL_SVCGSS_ERR_NOTIFY, OBD_FAIL_ONCE))
01965         //      RETURN(-EINVAL);
01966 
01967         grctx->src_err_notify = 1;
01968         grctx->src_reserve_len = 0;
01969 
01970         rc = lustre_pack_reply_v2(req, 1, &replen, NULL, 0);
01971         if (rc) {
01972                 CERROR("could not pack reply, err %d\n", rc);
01973                 RETURN(rc);
01974         }
01975 
01976         /* gss hdr */
01977         rs = req->rq_reply_state;
01978         LASSERT(rs->rs_repbuf->lm_buflens[1] >= sizeof(*ghdr));
01979         ghdr = lustre_msg_buf(rs->rs_repbuf, 0, 0);
01980         ghdr->gh_version = PTLRPC_GSS_VERSION;
01981         ghdr->gh_flags = 0;
01982         ghdr->gh_proc = PTLRPC_GSS_PROC_ERR;
01983         ghdr->gh_major = major;
01984         ghdr->gh_minor = minor;
01985         ghdr->gh_handle.len = 0; /* fake context handle */
01986 
01987         rs->rs_repdata_len = lustre_msg_size_v2(rs->rs_repbuf->lm_bufcount,
01988                                                 rs->rs_repbuf->lm_buflens);
01989 
01990         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "prepare gss error notify(0x%x/0x%x) to %s\n",
01991                major, minor, libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid));
01992         RETURN(0);
01993 }
01994 
01995 static
01996 int gss_svc_handle_init(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01997                         struct gss_wire_ctx *gw)
01998 {
01999         struct gss_svc_reqctx     *grctx = gss_svc_ctx2reqctx(req->rq_svc_ctx);
02000         struct lustre_msg         *reqbuf = req->rq_reqbuf;
02001         struct obd_uuid           *uuid;
02002         struct obd_device         *target;
02003         rawobj_t                   uuid_obj, rvs_hdl, in_token;
02004         __u32                      lustre_svc;
02005         __u32                     *secdata, seclen;
02006         int                        swabbed, rc;
02007         ENTRY;
02008 
02009         CDEBUG(D_SEC, "processing gss init(%d) request from %s\n", gw->gw_proc,
02010                libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid));
02011 
02012         req->rq_ctx_init = 1;
02013 
02014         if (gw->gw_flags & LUSTRE_GSS_PACK_BULK) {
02015                 CERROR("unexpected bulk flag\n");
02016                 RETURN(SECSVC_DROP);
02017         }
02018 
02019         if (gw->gw_proc == PTLRPC_GSS_PROC_INIT && gw->gw_handle.len != 0) {
02020                 CERROR("proc %u: invalid handle length %u\n",
02021                        gw->gw_proc, gw->gw_handle.len);
02022                 RETURN(SECSVC_DROP);
02023         }
02024 
02025         if (reqbuf->lm_bufcount < 3 || reqbuf->lm_bufcount > 4){
02026                 CERROR("Invalid bufcount %d\n", reqbuf->lm_bufcount);
02027                 RETURN(SECSVC_DROP);
02028         }
02029 
02030         swabbed = ptlrpc_req_need_swab(req);
02031 
02032         /* ctx initiate payload is in last segment */
02033         secdata = lustre_msg_buf(reqbuf, reqbuf->lm_bufcount - 1, 0);
02034         seclen = reqbuf->lm_buflens[reqbuf->lm_bufcount - 1];
02035 
02036         if (seclen < 4 + 4) {
02037                 CERROR("sec size %d too small\n", seclen);
02038                 RETURN(SECSVC_DROP);
02039         }
02040 
02041         /* lustre svc type */
02042         lustre_svc = le32_to_cpu(*secdata++);
02043         seclen -= 4;
02044 
02045         /* extract target uuid, note this code is somewhat fragile
02046          * because touched internal structure of obd_uuid */
02047         if (rawobj_extract(&uuid_obj, &secdata, &seclen)) {
02048                 CERROR("failed to extract target uuid\n");
02049                 RETURN(SECSVC_DROP);
02050         }
02051         uuid_obj.data[uuid_obj.len - 1] = '\0';
02052 
02053         uuid = (struct obd_uuid *) uuid_obj.data;
02054         target = class_uuid2obd(uuid);
02055         if (!target || target->obd_stopping || !target->obd_set_up) {
02056                 CERROR("target '%s' is not available for context init (%s)\n",
02057                        uuid->uuid, target == NULL ? "no target" :
02058                        (target->obd_stopping ? "stopping" : "not set up"));
02059                 RETURN(SECSVC_DROP);
02060         }
02061 
02062         /* extract reverse handle */
02063         if (rawobj_extract(&rvs_hdl, &secdata, &seclen)) {
02064                 CERROR("failed extract reverse handle\n");
