02065                 RETURN(SECSVC_DROP);
02066         }
02067 
02068         /* extract token */
02069         if (rawobj_extract(&in_token, &secdata, &seclen)) {
02070                 CERROR("can't extract token\n");
02071                 RETURN(SECSVC_DROP);
02072         }
02073 
02074         rc = gss_svc_upcall_handle_init(req, grctx, gw, target, lustre_svc,
02075                                         &rvs_hdl, &in_token);
02076         if (rc != SECSVC_OK)
02077                 RETURN(rc);
02078 
02079         if (grctx->src_ctx->gsc_usr_mds || grctx->src_ctx->gsc_usr_oss ||
02080             grctx->src_ctx->gsc_usr_root)
02081                 CWARN("create svc ctx %p: user from %s authenticated as %s\n",
02082                       grctx->src_ctx, libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid),
02083                       grctx->src_ctx->gsc_usr_mds ? "mds" :
02084                         (grctx->src_ctx->gsc_usr_oss ? "oss" : "root"));
02085         else
02086                 CWARN("create svc ctx %p: accept user %u from %s\n",
02087                       grctx->src_ctx, grctx->src_ctx->gsc_uid,
02088                       libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid));
02089 
02090         if (gw->gw_flags & LUSTRE_GSS_PACK_USER) {
02091                 if (reqbuf->lm_bufcount < 4) {
02092                         CERROR("missing user descriptor\n");
02093                         RETURN(SECSVC_DROP);
02094                 }
02095                 if (sptlrpc_unpack_user_desc(reqbuf, 2, swabbed)) {
02096                         CERROR("Mal-formed user descriptor\n");
02097                         RETURN(SECSVC_DROP);
02098                 }
02099 
02100                 req->rq_pack_udesc = 1;
02101                 req->rq_user_desc = lustre_msg_buf(reqbuf, 2, 0);
02102         }
02103 
02104         req->rq_reqmsg = lustre_msg_buf(reqbuf, 1, 0);
02105         req->rq_reqlen = lustre_msg_buflen(reqbuf, 1);
02106 
02107         RETURN(rc);
02108 }
02109 
02110 /*
02111  * last segment must be the gss signature.
02112  */
02113 static
02114 int gss_svc_verify_request(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
02115                            struct gss_svc_reqctx *grctx,
02116                            struct gss_wire_ctx *gw,
02117                            __u32 *major)
02118 {
02119         struct gss_svc_ctx *gctx = grctx->src_ctx;
02120         struct lustre_msg  *msg = req->rq_reqbuf;
02121         int                 offset = 2;
02122         int                 swabbed;
02123         ENTRY;
02124 
02125         *major = GSS_S_COMPLETE;
02126 
02127         if (msg->lm_bufcount < 2) {
02128                 CERROR("Too few segments (%u) in request\n", msg->lm_bufcount);
02129                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
02130         }
02131 
02132         if (gw->gw_svc == SPTLRPC_SVC_NULL)
02133                 goto verified;
02134 
02135         if (gss_check_seq_num(&gctx->gsc_seqdata, gw->gw_seq, 0)) {
02136                 CERROR("phase 0: discard replayed req: seq %u\n", gw->gw_seq);
02137                 *major = GSS_S_DUPLICATE_TOKEN;
02138                 RETURN(-EACCES);
02139         }
02140 
02141         *major = gss_verify_msg(msg, gctx->gsc_mechctx, gw->gw_svc);
02142         if (*major != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
02143                 CERROR("failed to verify request: %x\n", *major);
02144                 RETURN(-EACCES);
02145         }
02146 
02147         if (gctx->gsc_reverse == 0 &&
02148             gss_check_seq_num(&gctx->gsc_seqdata, gw->gw_seq, 1)) {
02149                 CERROR("phase 1+: discard replayed req: seq %u\n", gw->gw_seq);
02150                 *major = GSS_S_DUPLICATE_TOKEN;
02151                 RETURN(-EACCES);
02152         }
02153 
02154 verified:
02155         swabbed = ptlrpc_req_need_swab(req);
02156 
02157         /* user descriptor */
02158         if (gw->gw_flags & LUSTRE_GSS_PACK_USER) {
02159                 if (msg->lm_bufcount < (offset + 1)) {
02160                         CERROR("no user desc included\n");
02161                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
02162                 }
02163 
02164                 if (sptlrpc_unpack_user_desc(msg, offset, swabbed)) {
02165                         CERROR("Mal-formed user descriptor\n");
02166                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
02167                 }
02168 
02169                 req->rq_pack_udesc = 1;
02170                 req->rq_user_desc = lustre_msg_buf(msg, offset, 0);
02171                 offset++;
02172         }
02173 
02174         /* check bulk_sec_desc data */
02175         if (gw->gw_flags & LUSTRE_GSS_PACK_BULK) {
02176                 if (msg->lm_bufcount < (offset + 1)) {
02177                         CERROR("missing bulk sec descriptor\n");
02178                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
02179                 }
02180 
02181                 if (bulk_sec_desc_unpack(msg, offset, swabbed))
02182                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
02183 
02184                 req->rq_pack_bulk = 1;
02185                 grctx->src_reqbsd = lustre_msg_buf(msg, offset, 0);
02186                 grctx->src_reqbsd_size = lustre_msg_buflen(msg, offset);
02187         }
02188 
02189         req->rq_reqmsg = lustre_msg_buf(msg, 1, 0);
02190         req->rq_reqlen = msg->lm_buflens[1];
02191         RETURN(0);
02192 }
02193 
02194 static
02195 int gss_svc_unseal_request(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
02196                            struct gss_svc_reqctx *grctx,
02197                            struct gss_wire_ctx *gw,
02198                            __u32 *major)
02199 {
02200         struct gss_svc_ctx *gctx = grctx->src_ctx;
02201         struct lustre_msg  *msg = req->rq_reqbuf;
02202         int                 swabbed, msglen, offset = 1;
02203         ENTRY;
02204 
02205         if (gss_check_seq_num(&gctx->gsc_seqdata, gw->gw_seq, 0)) {
02206                 CERROR("phase 0: discard replayed req: seq %u\n", gw->gw_seq);
02207                 *major = GSS_S_DUPLICATE_TOKEN;
02208                 RETURN(-EACCES);
02209         }
02210 
02211         *major = gss_unseal_msg(gctx->gsc_mechctx, msg,
02212                                &msglen, req->rq_reqdata_len);
02213         if (*major != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
02214                 CERROR("failed to unwrap request: %x\n", *major);
02215                 RETURN(-EACCES);
02216         }
02217 
02218         if (gss_check_seq_num(&gctx->gsc_seqdata, gw->gw_seq, 1)) {
02219                 CERROR("phase 1+: discard replayed req: seq %u\n", gw->gw_seq);
02220                 *major = GSS_S_DUPLICATE_TOKEN;
02221                 RETURN(-EACCES);
02222         }
02223 
02224         swabbed = __lustre_unpack_msg(msg, msglen);
02225         if (swabbed < 0) {
02226                 CERROR("Failed to unpack after decryption\n");
02227                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
02228         }
02229         req->rq_reqdata_len = msglen;
02230 
02231         if (msg->lm_bufcount < 1) {
02232                 CERROR("Invalid buffer: is empty\n");
02233                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
02234         }
02235 
02236         if (gw->gw_flags & LUSTRE_GSS_PACK_USER) {
02237                 if (msg->lm_bufcount < offset + 1) {
02238                         CERROR("no user descriptor included\n");
02239                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
02240                 }
02241 
02242                 if (sptlrpc_unpack_user_desc(msg, offset, swabbed)) {
02243                         CERROR("Mal-formed user descriptor\n");
02244                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
02245                 }
02246 
02247                 req->rq_pack_udesc = 1;
02248                 req->rq_user_desc = lustre_msg_buf(msg, offset, 0);
02249                 offset++;
02250         }
02251 
02252         if (gw->gw_flags & LUSTRE_GSS_PACK_BULK) {
02253                 if (msg->lm_bufcount < offset + 1) {
02254                         CERROR("no bulk checksum included\n");
02255                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
02256                 }
02257 
02258                 if (bulk_sec_desc_unpack(msg, offset, swabbed))
02259                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
02260 
02261                 req->rq_pack_bulk = 1;
02262                 grctx->src_reqbsd = lustre_msg_buf(msg, offset, 0);
02263                 grctx->src_reqbsd_size = lustre_msg_buflen(msg, offset);
02264         }
02265 
02266         req->rq_reqmsg = lustre_msg_buf(req->rq_reqbuf, 0, 0);
02267         req->rq_reqlen = req->rq_reqbuf->lm_buflens[0];
02268         RETURN(0);
02269 }
02270 
02271 static
02272 int gss_svc_handle_data(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
02273                         struct gss_wire_ctx *gw)
02274 {
02275         struct gss_svc_reqctx *grctx = gss_svc_ctx2reqctx(req->rq_svc_ctx);
02276         __u32                  major = 0;
02277         int                    rc = 0;
02278         ENTRY;
02279 
02280         grctx->src_ctx = gss_svc_upcall_get_ctx(req, gw);
02281         if (!grctx->src_ctx) {
02282                 major = GSS_S_NO_CONTEXT;
02283                 goto error;
02284         }
02285 
02286         switch (gw->gw_svc) {
02287         case SPTLRPC_SVC_NULL:
02288         case SPTLRPC_SVC_AUTH:
02289         case SPTLRPC_SVC_INTG:
02290                 rc = gss_svc_verify_request(req, grctx, gw, &major);
02291                 break;
02292         case SPTLRPC_SVC_PRIV:
02293                 rc = gss_svc_unseal_request(req, grctx, gw, &major);
02294                 break;
02295         default:
02296                 CERROR("unsupported gss service %d\n", gw->gw_svc);
02297                 rc = -EINVAL;
02298         }
02299 
02300         if (rc == 0)
02301                 RETURN(SECSVC_OK);
02302 
02303         CERROR("svc %u failed: major 0x%08x: req xid "LPU64" ctx %p idx "
02304                LPX64"(%u->%s)\n", gw->gw_svc, major, req->rq_xid,
02305                grctx->src_ctx, gss_handle_to_u64(&gw->gw_handle),
02306                grctx->src_ctx->gsc_uid, libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid));
02307 error:
02308         /* we only notify client in case of NO_CONTEXT/BAD_SIG, which
02309          * might happen after server reboot, to allow recovery. */
02310         if ((major == GSS_S_NO_CONTEXT || major == GSS_S_BAD_SIG) &&
02311             gss_pack_err_notify(req, major, 0) == 0)
02312                 RETURN(SECSVC_COMPLETE);
02313 
02314         RETURN(SECSVC_DROP);
02315 }
02316 
02317 static
02318 int gss_svc_handle_destroy(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
02319                            struct gss_wire_ctx *gw)
02320 {
02321         struct gss_svc_reqctx  *grctx = gss_svc_ctx2reqctx(req->rq_svc_ctx);
02322         __u32                   major;
02323         ENTRY;
02324 
02325         req->rq_ctx_fini = 1;
02326         req->rq_no_reply = 1;
02327 
02328         grctx->src_ctx = gss_svc_upcall_get_ctx(req, gw);
02329         if (!grctx->src_ctx) {
02330                 CDEBUG(D_SEC, "invalid gss context handle for destroy.\n");
02331                 RETURN(SECSVC_DROP);
02332         }
02333 
02334         if (gw->gw_svc != SPTLRPC_SVC_INTG) {
02335                 CERROR("svc %u is not supported in destroy.\n", gw->gw_svc);
02336                 RETURN(SECSVC_DROP);
02337         }
02338 
02339         if (gss_svc_verify_request(req, grctx, gw, &major))
02340                 RETURN(SECSVC_DROP);
02341 
02342         CWARN("destroy svc ctx %p idx "LPX64" (%u->%s)\n",
02343               grctx->src_ctx, gss_handle_to_u64(&gw->gw_handle),
02344               grctx->src_ctx->gsc_uid, libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_peer.nid));
02345 
02346         gss_svc_upcall_destroy_ctx(grctx->src_ctx);
02347 
02348         if (gw->gw_flags & LUSTRE_GSS_PACK_USER) {
02349                 if (req->rq_reqbuf->lm_bufcount < 4) {
02350                         CERROR("missing user descriptor, ignore it\n");
02351                         RETURN(SECSVC_OK);
02352                 }
02353                 if (sptlrpc_unpack_user_desc(req->rq_reqbuf, 2,
02354                                              ptlrpc_req_need_swab(req))) {
02355                         CERROR("Mal-formed user descriptor, ignore it\n");
02356                         RETURN(SECSVC_OK);
02357                 }
02358 
02359                 req->rq_pack_udesc = 1;
02360                 req->rq_user_desc = lustre_msg_buf(req->rq_reqbuf, 2, 0);
02361         }
02362 
02363         RETURN(SECSVC_OK);
02364 }
02365 
02366 int gss_svc_accept(struct ptlrpc_sec_policy *policy, struct ptlrpc_request *req)
02367 {
02368         struct gss_header      *ghdr;
02369         struct gss_svc_reqctx  *grctx;
02370         struct gss_wire_ctx    *gw;
02371         int                     swabbed, rc;
02372         ENTRY;
02373 
02374         LASSERT(req->rq_reqbuf);
02375         LASSERT(req->rq_svc_ctx == NULL);
02376 
02377         if (req->rq_reqbuf->lm_bufcount < 2) {
02378                 CERROR("buf count only %d\n", req->rq_reqbuf->lm_bufcount);
02379                 RETURN(SECSVC_DROP);
02380         }
02381 
02382         swabbed = ptlrpc_req_need_swab(req);
02383 
02384         ghdr = gss_swab_header(req->rq_reqbuf, 0, swabbed);
02385         if (ghdr == NULL) {
02386                 CERROR("can't decode gss header\n");
02387                 RETURN(SECSVC_DROP);
02388         }
02389 
02390         /* sanity checks */
02391         if (ghdr->gh_version != PTLRPC_GSS_VERSION) {
02392                 CERROR("gss version %u, expect %u\n", ghdr->gh_version,
02393                        PTLRPC_GSS_VERSION);
02394                 RETURN(SECSVC_DROP);
02395         }
02396 
02397         req->rq_sp_from = ghdr->gh_sp;
02398 
02399         /* alloc grctx data */
02400         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(grctx);
02401         if (!grctx)
02402                 RETURN(SECSVC_DROP);
02403 
02404         grctx->src_base.sc_policy = sptlrpc_policy_get(policy);
02405         atomic_set(&grctx->src_base.sc_refcount, 1);
02406         req->rq_svc_ctx = &grctx->src_base;
02407         gw = &grctx->src_wirectx;
02408 
02409         /* save wire context */
02410         gw->gw_flags = ghdr->gh_flags;
02411         gw->gw_proc = ghdr->gh_proc;
02412         gw->gw_seq = ghdr->gh_seq;
02413         gw->gw_svc = ghdr->gh_svc;
02414         rawobj_from_netobj(&gw->gw_handle, &ghdr->gh_handle);
02415 
02416         /* keep original wire header which subject to checksum verification */
02417         if (swabbed)
02418                 gss_header_swabber(ghdr);
02419 
02420         switch(ghdr->gh_proc) {
02421         case PTLRPC_GSS_PROC_INIT:
02422         case PTLRPC_GSS_PROC_CONTINUE_INIT:
02423                 rc = gss_svc_handle_init(req, gw);
02424                 break;
02425         case PTLRPC_GSS_PROC_DATA:
02426                 rc = gss_svc_handle_data(req, gw);
02427                 break;
02428         case PTLRPC_GSS_PROC_DESTROY:
02429                 rc = gss_svc_handle_destroy(req, gw);
02430                 break;
02431         default:
02432                 CERROR("unknown proc %u\n", gw->gw_proc);
02433                 rc = SECSVC_DROP;
02434                 break;
02435         }
02436 
02437         switch (rc) {
02438         case SECSVC_OK:
02439                 LASSERT (grctx->src_ctx);
02440 
02441                 req->rq_auth_gss = 1;
02442                 req->rq_auth_remote = grctx->src_ctx->gsc_remote;
02443                 req->rq_auth_usr_mdt = grctx->src_ctx->gsc_usr_mds;
02444                 req->rq_auth_usr_ost = grctx->src_ctx->gsc_usr_oss;
02445                 req->rq_auth_usr_root = grctx->src_ctx->gsc_usr_root;
02446                 req->rq_auth_uid = grctx->src_ctx->gsc_uid;
02447                 req->rq_auth_mapped_uid = grctx->src_ctx->gsc_mapped_uid;
02448                 break;
02449         case SECSVC_COMPLETE:
02450                 break;
02451         case SECSVC_DROP:
02452                 gss_svc_reqctx_free(grctx);
02453                 req->rq_svc_ctx = NULL;
02454                 break;
02455         }
02456 
02457         RETURN(rc);
02458 }
02459 
02460 void gss_svc_invalidate_ctx(struct ptlrpc_svc_ctx *svc_ctx)
02461 {
02462         struct gss_svc_reqctx  *grctx;
02463         ENTRY;
02464 
02465         if (svc_ctx == NULL) {
02466                 EXIT;
02467                 return;
02468         }
02469 
02470         grctx = gss_svc_ctx2reqctx(svc_ctx);
02471 
02472         CWARN("gss svc invalidate ctx %p(%u)\n",
02473               grctx->src_ctx, grctx->src_ctx->gsc_uid);
02474         gss_svc_upcall_destroy_ctx(grctx->src_ctx);
02475 
02476         EXIT;
02477 }
02478 
02479 static inline
02480 int gss_svc_payload(struct gss_svc_reqctx *grctx, int early,
02481                     int msgsize, int privacy)
02482 {
02483         /* we should treat early reply normally, but which is actually sharing
02484          * the same ctx with original request, so in this case we should
02485          * ignore the special ctx's special flags */
02486         if (early == 0 && gss_svc_reqctx_is_special(grctx))
02487                 return grctx->src_reserve_len;
02488 
02489         return gss_mech_payload(NULL, msgsize, privacy);
02490 }
02491 
02492 static int gss_svc_bulk_payload(struct gss_svc_ctx *gctx,
02493                                 struct sptlrpc_flavor *flvr,
02494                                 int read)
02495 {
02496         int     payload = sizeof(struct ptlrpc_bulk_sec_desc);
02497 
02498         if (read) {
02499                 switch (SPTLRPC_FLVR_BULK_SVC(flvr->sf_rpc)) {
02500                 case SPTLRPC_BULK_SVC_NULL:
02501                         break;
02502                 case SPTLRPC_BULK_SVC_INTG:
02503                         payload += gss_mech_payload(NULL, 0, 0);
02504                         break;
02505                 case SPTLRPC_BULK_SVC_PRIV:
02506                         payload += gss_mech_payload(NULL, 0, 1);
02507                         break;
02508                 case SPTLRPC_BULK_SVC_AUTH:
02509                 default:
02510                         LBUG();
02511                 }
02512         }
02513 
02514         return payload;
02515 }
02516 
02517 int gss_svc_alloc_rs(struct ptlrpc_request *req, int msglen)
02518 {
02519         struct gss_svc_reqctx       *grctx;
02520         struct ptlrpc_reply_state   *rs;
02521         int                          early, privacy, svc, bsd_off = 0;
02522         __u32                        ibuflens[2], buflens[4];
02523         int                          ibufcnt = 0, bufcnt;
02524         int                          txtsize, wmsg_size, rs_size;
02525         ENTRY;
02526 
02527         LASSERT(msglen % 8 == 0);
02528 
02529         if (req->rq_pack_bulk && !req->rq_bulk_read && !req->rq_bulk_write) {
02530                 CERROR("client request bulk sec on non-bulk rpc\n");
02531                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
02532         }
02533 
02534         svc = SPTLRPC_FLVR_SVC(req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc);
02535         early = (req->rq_packed_final == 0);
02536 
02537         grctx = gss_svc_ctx2reqctx(req->rq_svc_ctx);
02538         if (!early && gss_svc_reqctx_is_special(grctx))
02539                 privacy = 0;
02540         else
02541                 privacy = (svc == SPTLRPC_SVC_PRIV);
02542 
02543         if (privacy) {
02544                 /* inner clear buffers */
02545                 ibufcnt = 1;
02546                 ibuflens[0] = msglen;
02547 
02548                 if (req->rq_pack_bulk) {
02549                         LASSERT(grctx->src_reqbsd);
02550 
02551                         bsd_off = ibufcnt;
02552                         ibuflens[ibufcnt++] = gss_svc_bulk_payload(
02553                                                         grctx->src_ctx,
02554                                                         &req->rq_flvr,
02555                                                         req->rq_bulk_read);
02556                 }
02557 
02558                 txtsize = lustre_msg_size_v2(ibufcnt, ibuflens);
02559                 txtsize += GSS_MAX_CIPHER_BLOCK;
02560 
02561                 /* wrapper buffer */
02562                 bufcnt = 2;
02563                 buflens[0] = PTLRPC_GSS_HEADER_SIZE;
02564                 buflens[1] = gss_svc_payload(grctx, early, txtsize, 1);
02565         } else {
02566                 bufcnt = 2;
02567                 buflens[0] = PTLRPC_GSS_HEADER_SIZE;
02568                 buflens[1] = msglen;
02569 
02570                 txtsize = buflens[0];
02571                 if (svc == SPTLRPC_SVC_INTG)
02572                         txtsize += buflens[1];
02573 
02574                 if (req->rq_pack_bulk) {
02575                         LASSERT(grctx->src_reqbsd);
02576 
02577                         bsd_off = bufcnt;
02578                         buflens[bufcnt] = gss_svc_bulk_payload(
02579                                                         grctx->src_ctx,
02580                                                         &req->rq_flvr,
02581                                                         req->rq_bulk_read);
02582                         if (svc == SPTLRPC_SVC_INTG)
02583                                 txtsize += buflens[bufcnt];
02584                         bufcnt++;
02585                 }
02586 
02587                 if ((!early && gss_svc_reqctx_is_special(grctx)) ||
02588                     svc != SPTLRPC_SVC_NULL)
02589                         buflens[bufcnt++] = gss_svc_payload(grctx, early,
02590                                                             txtsize, 0);
02591         }
02592 
02593         wmsg_size = lustre_msg_size_v2(bufcnt, buflens);
02594 
02595         rs_size = sizeof(*rs) + wmsg_size;
02596         rs = req->rq_reply_state;
02597 
02598         if (rs) {
02599                 /* pre-allocated */
02600                 LASSERT(rs->rs_size >= rs_size);
02601         } else {
02602                 OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(rs, rs_size);
02603                 if (rs == NULL)
02604                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02605 
02606                 rs->rs_size = rs_size;
02607         }
02608 
02609         rs->rs_repbuf = (struct lustre_msg *) (rs + 1);
02610         rs->rs_repbuf_len = wmsg_size;
02611 
02612         /* initialize the buffer */
02613         if (privacy) {
02614                 lustre_init_msg_v2(rs->rs_repbuf, ibufcnt, ibuflens, NULL);
02615                 rs->rs_msg = lustre_msg_buf(rs->rs_repbuf, 0, msglen);
02616         } else {
02617                 lustre_init_msg_v2(rs->rs_repbuf, bufcnt, buflens, NULL);
02618                 rs->rs_repbuf->lm_secflvr = req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc;
02619 
02620                 rs->rs_msg = lustre_msg_buf(rs->rs_repbuf, 1, 0);
02621         }
02622 
02623         if (bsd_off) {
02624                 grctx->src_repbsd = lustre_msg_buf(rs->rs_repbuf, bsd_off, 0);
02625                 grctx->src_repbsd_size = lustre_msg_buflen(rs->rs_repbuf,
02626                                                            bsd_off);
02627         }
02628 
02629         gss_svc_reqctx_addref(grctx);
02630         rs->rs_svc_ctx = req->rq_svc_ctx;
02631 
02632         LASSERT(rs->rs_msg);
02633         req->rq_reply_state = rs;
02634         RETURN(0);
02635 }
02636 
02637 static int gss_svc_seal(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
02638                         struct ptlrpc_reply_state *rs,
02639                         struct gss_svc_reqctx *grctx)
02640 {
02641         struct gss_svc_ctx      *gctx = grctx->src_ctx;
02642         rawobj_t                 hdrobj, msgobj, token;
02643         struct gss_header       *ghdr;
02644         __u8                    *token_buf;
02645         int                      token_buflen; 
02646         __u32                    buflens[2], major;
02647         int                      msglen, rc;
02648         ENTRY;
02649 
02650         /* get clear data length. note embedded lustre_msg might
02651          * have been shrunk */
02652         if (req->rq_replen != lustre_msg_buflen(rs->rs_repbuf, 0))
02653                 msglen = lustre_shrink_msg(rs->rs_repbuf, 0, req->rq_replen, 1);
02654         else 
02655                 msglen = lustre_msg_size_v2(rs->rs_repbuf->lm_bufcount,
02656                                             rs->rs_repbuf->lm_buflens);
02657 
02658         /* temporarily use tail of buffer to hold gss header data */
02659         LASSERT(msglen + PTLRPC_GSS_HEADER_SIZE <= rs->rs_repbuf_len);
02660         ghdr = (struct gss_header *) ((char *) rs->rs_repbuf +
02661                                 rs->rs_repbuf_len - PTLRPC_GSS_HEADER_SIZE);
02662         ghdr->gh_version = PTLRPC_GSS_VERSION;
02663         ghdr->gh_sp = LUSTRE_SP_ANY;
02664         ghdr->gh_flags = 0;
02665         ghdr->gh_proc = PTLRPC_GSS_PROC_DATA;
02666         ghdr->gh_seq = grctx->src_wirectx.gw_seq;
02667         ghdr->gh_svc = SPTLRPC_SVC_PRIV;
02668         ghdr->gh_handle.len = 0;
02669         if (req->rq_pack_bulk)
02670                 ghdr->gh_flags |= LUSTRE_GSS_PACK_BULK;
02671 
02672         /* allocate temporary cipher buffer */
02673         token_buflen = gss_mech_payload(gctx->gsc_mechctx, msglen, 1);
02674         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(token_buf, token_buflen);
02675         if (token_buf == NULL)
02676                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02677 
02678         hdrobj.len = PTLRPC_GSS_HEADER_SIZE;
02679         hdrobj.data = (__u8 *) ghdr;
02680         msgobj.len = msglen;
02681         msgobj.data = (__u8 *) rs->rs_repbuf;
02682         token.len = token_buflen;
02683         token.data = token_buf;
02684 
02685         major = lgss_wrap(gctx->gsc_mechctx, &hdrobj, &msgobj,
02686                           rs->rs_repbuf_len - PTLRPC_GSS_HEADER_SIZE, &token);
02687         if (major != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
02688                 CERROR("wrap message error: %08x\n", major);
02689                 GOTO(out_free, rc = -EPERM);
02690         }
02691         LASSERT(token.len <= token_buflen);
02692 
02693         /* we are about to override data at rs->rs_repbuf, nullify pointers
02694          * to which to catch further illegal usage. */
02695         if (req->rq_pack_bulk) {
02696                 grctx->src_repbsd = NULL;
02697                 grctx->src_repbsd_size = 0;
02698         }
02699 
02700         /* now fill the actual wire data
02701          * - gss header
02702          * - gss token
02703          */
02704         buflens[0] = PTLRPC_GSS_HEADER_SIZE;
02705         buflens[1] = token.len;
02706 
02707         rs->rs_repdata_len = lustre_msg_size_v2(2, buflens);
02708         LASSERT(rs->rs_repdata_len <= rs->rs_repbuf_len);
02709 
02710         lustre_init_msg_v2(rs->rs_repbuf, 2, buflens, NULL);
02711         rs->rs_repbuf->lm_secflvr = req->rq_flvr.sf_rpc;
02712 
02713         memcpy(lustre_msg_buf(rs->rs_repbuf, 0, 0), ghdr,
02714                PTLRPC_GSS_HEADER_SIZE);
02715         memcpy(lustre_msg_buf(rs->rs_repbuf, 1, 0), token.data, token.len);
02716 
02717         /* reply offset */
02718         if (req->rq_packed_final &&
02719             (lustre_msghdr_get_flags(req->rq_reqmsg) & MSGHDR_AT_SUPPORT))
02720                 req->rq_reply_off = gss_at_reply_off_priv;
02721         else
02722                 req->rq_reply_off = 0;
02723 
02724         /* to catch upper layer's further access */
02725         rs->rs_msg = NULL;
02726         req->rq_repmsg = NULL;
02727         req->rq_replen = 0;
02728 
02729         rc = 0;
02730 out_free:
02731         OBD_FREE_LARGE(token_buf, token_buflen);
02732         RETURN(rc);
02733 }
02734 
02735 int gss_svc_authorize(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
02736 {
02737         struct ptlrpc_reply_state *rs = req->rq_reply_state;
02738         struct gss_svc_reqctx     *grctx = gss_svc_ctx2reqctx(req->rq_svc_ctx);
02739         struct gss_wire_ctx       *gw = &grctx->src_wirectx;
02740         int                        early, rc;
02741         ENTRY;
02742 
02743         early = (req->rq_packed_final == 0);
02744 
02745         if (!early && gss_svc_reqctx_is_special(grctx)) {
02746                 LASSERT(rs->rs_repdata_len != 0);
02747 
02748                 req->rq_reply_off = gss_at_reply_off_integ;
02749                 RETURN(0);
02750         }
02751 
02752         /* early reply could happen in many cases */
02753         if (!early &&
02754             gw->gw_proc != PTLRPC_GSS_PROC_DATA &&
02755             gw->gw_proc != PTLRPC_GSS_PROC_DESTROY) {
02756                 CERROR("proc %d not support\n", gw->gw_proc);
02757                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
02758         }
02759 
02760         LASSERT(grctx->src_ctx);
02761 
02762         switch (gw->gw_svc) {
02763         case SPTLRPC_SVC_NULL:
02764         case SPTLRPC_SVC_AUTH:
02765         case SPTLRPC_SVC_INTG:
02766                 rc = gss_svc_sign(req, rs, grctx, gw->gw_svc);
02767                 break;
02768         case SPTLRPC_SVC_PRIV:
02769                 rc = gss_svc_seal(req, rs, grctx);
02770                 break;
02771         default:
02772                 CERROR("Unknown service %d\n", gw->gw_svc);
02773                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
02774         }
02775         rc = 0;
02776 
02777 out:
02778         RETURN(rc);
02779 }
02780 
02781 void gss_svc_free_rs(struct ptlrpc_reply_state *rs)
02782 {
02783         struct gss_svc_reqctx *grctx;
02784 
02785         LASSERT(rs->rs_svc_ctx);
02786         grctx = container_of(rs->rs_svc_ctx, struct gss_svc_reqctx, src_base);
02787 
02788         gss_svc_reqctx_decref(grctx);
02789         rs->rs_svc_ctx = NULL;
02790 
02791         if (!rs->rs_prealloc)
02792                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(rs, rs->rs_size);
02793 }
02794 
02795 void gss_svc_free_ctx(struct ptlrpc_svc_ctx *ctx)
02796 {
02797         LASSERT(atomic_read(&ctx->sc_refcount) == 0);
02798         gss_svc_reqctx_free(gss_svc_ctx2reqctx(ctx));
02799 }
02800 
02801 int gss_copy_rvc_cli_ctx(struct ptlrpc_cli_ctx *cli_ctx,
02802                          struct ptlrpc_svc_ctx *svc_ctx)
02803 {
02804         struct gss_cli_ctx     *cli_gctx = ctx2gctx(cli_ctx);
02805         struct gss_svc_ctx     *svc_gctx = gss_svc_ctx2gssctx(svc_ctx);
02806         struct gss_ctx         *mechctx = NULL;
02807 
02808         LASSERT(cli_gctx);
02809         LASSERT(svc_gctx && svc_gctx->gsc_mechctx);
02810 
02811         cli_gctx->gc_proc = PTLRPC_GSS_PROC_DATA;
02812         cli_gctx->gc_win = GSS_SEQ_WIN;
02813 
02814         /* The problem is the reverse ctx might get lost in some recovery
02815          * situations, and the same svc_ctx will be used to re-create it.
02816          * if there's callback be sentout before that, new reverse ctx start
02817          * with sequence 0 will lead to future callback rpc be treated as
02818          * replay.
02819          *
02820          * each reverse root ctx will record its latest sequence number on its
02821          * buddy svcctx before be destroyed, so here we continue use it.
02822          */
02823         atomic_set(&cli_gctx->gc_seq, svc_gctx->gsc_rvs_seq);
02824 
02825         if (gss_svc_upcall_dup_handle(&cli_gctx->gc_svc_handle, svc_gctx)) {
02826                 CERROR("failed to dup svc handle\n");
02827                 goto err_out;
02828         }
02829 
02830         if (lgss_copy_reverse_context(svc_gctx->gsc_mechctx, &mechctx) !=
02831             GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
02832                 CERROR("failed to copy mech context\n");
02833                 goto err_svc_handle;
02834         }
02835 
02836         if (rawobj_dup(&cli_gctx->gc_handle, &svc_gctx->gsc_rvs_hdl)) {
02837                 CERROR("failed to dup reverse handle\n");
02838                 goto err_ctx;
02839         }
02840 
02841         cli_gctx->gc_mechctx = mechctx;
02842         gss_cli_ctx_uptodate(cli_gctx);
02843 
02844         return 0;
02845 
02846 err_ctx:
02847         lgss_delete_sec_context(&mechctx);
02848 err_svc_handle:
02849         rawobj_free(&cli_gctx->gc_svc_handle);
02850 err_out:
02851         return -ENOMEM;
02852 }
02853 
02854 static void gss_init_at_reply_offset(void)
02855 {
02856         __u32 buflens[3];
02857         int clearsize;
02858 
02859         buflens[0] = PTLRPC_GSS_HEADER_SIZE;
02860         buflens[1] = lustre_msg_early_size();
02861         buflens[2] = gss_cli_payload(NULL, buflens[1], 0);
02862         gss_at_reply_off_integ = lustre_msg_size_v2(3, buflens);
02863 
02864         buflens[0] = lustre_msg_early_size();
02865         clearsize = lustre_msg_size_v2(1, buflens);
02866         buflens[0] = PTLRPC_GSS_HEADER_SIZE;
02867         buflens[1] = gss_cli_payload(NULL, clearsize, 0);
02868         buflens[2] = gss_cli_payload(NULL, clearsize, 1);
02869         gss_at_reply_off_priv = lustre_msg_size_v2(3, buflens);
02870 }
02871 
02872 static int __init sptlrpc_gss_init(void)
02873 {
02874         int rc;
02875 
02876         rc = gss_init_lproc();
02877         if (rc)
02878                 return rc;
02879 
02880         rc = gss_init_cli_upcall();
02881         if (rc)
02882                 goto out_lproc;
02883 
02884         rc = gss_init_svc_upcall();
02885         if (rc)
02886                 goto out_cli_upcall;
02887 
02888         rc = init_null_module();
02889         if (rc)
02890                 goto out_svc_upcall;
02891 
02892         rc = init_kerberos_module();
02893         if (rc)
02894                 goto out_null;
02895 
02896         rc = init_sk_module();
02897         if (rc)
02898                 goto out_kerberos;
02899 
02900         /* register policy after all other stuff be initialized, because it
02901          * might be in used immediately after the registration. */
02902 
02903         rc = gss_init_keyring();
02904         if (rc)
02905                 goto out_sk;
02906 
02907         rc = gss_init_pipefs();
02908         if (rc)
02909                 goto out_keyring;
02910 
02911         gss_init_at_reply_offset();
02912 
02913         return 0;
02914 
02915 out_keyring:
02916         gss_exit_keyring();
02917 out_sk:
02918         cleanup_sk_module();
02919 out_kerberos:
02920         cleanup_kerberos_module();
02921 out_null:
02922         cleanup_null_module();
02923 out_svc_upcall:
02924         gss_exit_svc_upcall();
02925 out_cli_upcall:
02926         gss_exit_cli_upcall();
02927 out_lproc:
02928         gss_exit_lproc();
02929         return rc;
02930 }
02931 
02932 static void __exit sptlrpc_gss_exit(void)
02933 {
02934         gss_exit_keyring();
02935         gss_exit_pipefs();
02936         cleanup_kerberos_module();
02937         gss_exit_svc_upcall();
02938         gss_exit_cli_upcall();
02939         gss_exit_lproc();
02940 }
02941 
02942 MODULE_AUTHOR("OpenSFS, Inc. <http://www.lustre.org/>");
02943 MODULE_DESCRIPTION("Lustre GSS security policy");
02944 MODULE_VERSION(LUSTRE_VERSION_STRING);
02945 MODULE_LICENSE("GPL");
02946 
02947 module_init(sptlrpc_gss_init);
02948 module_exit(sptlrpc_gss_exit);
